review.des: With its delicious caramelized crust, perfect sauce and cheese to topping ratio, Pequod's is hands down the best deep dish in the city. Pass the ranch.

I LOVE their pizza -- my husband and I agree that it is hands-down the best deep-dish pizza we've had in Chicago. They caramelize the crust and it is wonderful.

The star down is for wait-time when it's busy. They're really great when it's an off time and they're not busy. Super friendly and helpful, but they need to do something about how they handle customers during the busy times. They don't take reservations, instead they have a priority seating list that puts you at the top of the wait list when you arrive. When I went with a large-ish group, they told me we'd have about a 45 minute wait. It took about 90 minutes, and we had something scheduled (and paid for and reserved) right afterwards, so it was super stressful trying to get dinner before we went to our event, and we weren't even really able to enjoy ourselves -- just ordered a couple of pizzas, had a beer, and had to take off. So, not the best place to go for dinner if you have somewhere else to be later, but still good food.

Like I said, when they're not busy, the experience is great. They always have a game on and have great food. The service staff makes great recommendations for beer when asked and the atmosphere fits in well with a sports bar -- a little dark on the inside, but all the better to watch a game, eat pizza, and have a drink. If you come with a large group, be prepared to be a little squished. They don't have a ton of room and are quite busy during the dinner hour.

You need to plan ahead if you want delivery. To my location it's 2 hours but well worth the wait. A thick airy crust topped with plenty of cheese and tasty sauce. I recommend the sausage and pepperoni.  I have had pizza from.many places and states but have never had pizza like this.

I have heard so many good things about Pequod's pizza from all of my friends, but I just don't think it's that good. I've had it 3 times now, and have never really enjoyed it. I usually don't write yelp reviews, but I felt it was necessary for this pizza.

I ordered a half sausage with cheese and half spinach and mushroom with cheese deep dish pizza. If you like a deep dish pizza with 95 bread and no cheese or toppings, then this is where you want to order from. I don't know if they decide to not try on takeout orders, that's what I've heard, but this pizza was so bad, I needed to write a review. I felt ripped off. Please observe picture.

I prefer uno's, due's, lou's, giordano's, and even dominos to pequods. Would probably never order myself again, but if my friends want to order pequods, I hope it will be better than this past pizza.

Chicago is well known for their deep dish pizza but you would for sure be missing out if you didn't try Pequod's pan pizza. I could eat it all day, every day. The dough is thick and the perfect mixture of soft and firm. The sauce is not too chunky with vegetables (onions and tomatoes) and this comes from someone who hates chunky sauce. The crispy edges of the pan pizza is so good! The garlic bread was also scrumptious, as were the mozzarella sticks. One of my favorite Lincoln Park treasures :)
In a city of pretenders trying to hang with the big dogs, Pequad's stands out. Great pizza and crust!

I have eaten at Pequod's and have had it delivered.  Both are extremely delicious and the delivery enables one to not have to wait forever.  Their spinach/garlic pan is so delicious with the caramelized crust.  The last time it was delivered, the pizza seemed a bit doughy and I would have liked it to have more cheese/tomato sauce.  Perhaps it was a random occurrence since I don't remember Pequod's being super doughy like this before.  I have also tried their thin crust with basil and it is delicious.  I recommend Pequod's for both deep dish and thin crust.  All of their ingredients are well-done and they do not skimp on them.

Being a Chicagoan, I've had my fair share of pizza and there is a reason why this pizza joint always has an hour long wait outside and two hour window of delivery...BECAUSE IT IS SIMPLY AMAZING.

Their stuffed pepperoni pizza is the best tasting pizza ever. I don't know how they do it time after time but it's delicious and I'm addicted to it. The wait is WORTH IT. Also their pequods salad is a great addition to their pizza. They produce quality pizza and it's a pizza place you must try in Chicago.

great, fresh and hot pizza in morton grove.  
YUMM

I am probably saying something that is considered sacrilegious in Chicago, but, in our household's opinion, Pequod's pizza is totally overrated. Aside from having to wait on hold for more than 15 minutes to try to get it ordered for delivery, the pizza we picked up had absolutely no flavor whatsoever. The Italian sausage tasted like unseasoned ground beef and the tomato sauce had no flavor. Sorry for this, but this may the first pizza we have not finished and didn't want to save for leftovers.
Solid pizza, great crust, usually busy but understandable given the food. Favorite pizza in Chicago.

Everyone has a different  idea  of  what is THE BEST. Best pizza,  best  burger,  etc.  I really like the pizza here because it's a little  different.  I like  ordering the personal  pan pizza's.  I like the way they are cooked  in those  old  skillets.  And  the toppings  are fresh and plentiful.   For me,  this place has the BEST  pizza.

This place is overrated. The pizza wasn't the best, I've had better. But what was very disappointing was the terrible service we got from our server. She was not friendly at all and kept giving us an attitude for no reason. And the wait was extremely long.

Wow! Don't go to the popular place everyone goes. Go get pizza at local places like this. I loved it! The Pizza sauce is wonderful.
My husband pointed out to me how the pizza is made in Chicago.  Crust, Cheese, and then the sauce is on top of the cheese along with all the toppings.  WHAT A GREAT IDEA!!!  I wish everyone made pizza this way.
The crust at this place was crispy and tasty, takes about 40 minutes to make the pizza so don't show up starving, but don't go eat before you come here because there is a lot of pizza to eat and enjoy.
I didn't realize there was an upstairs till we were seated up there.  This place is much larger then I expected and perfectly placed in a wonderful community where you can walk around and enjoy the outside shopping areas around as you wait to be seated and enjoy wonderful food.

This is probably the best deep dish pizza you can find in Chicago. It is absolutely delicious down to the last bite! The line/wait is usually incredibly long, which is the main turn off, but despite that the prices are great and the pizza is even better! If you are in Chicago for a weekend, a month, or a year, you have to come here at least once (if you can limit it to just one time). And if the line is long, just hold out because it is so worth it.

I really wish i saved my picture from the times I've ate here, but clearly I was always toooooooooo hungry that I forget to take a picture. The food here is phenomenal, the pizza here is MY FAV PIZZA in Chicago. This spot is underrated, the food, the environment, everything is great! Love this place!
Best pizza in chicago. The place is a little small and might seem cramped for moments, but you can wait next door at their new bar while your pie ia cooking. Expect to wait in line for a while.

Pizza was pretty good but not enough for us to want to go back. We asked them for a romantic table and were put on the crowded second floor middle row tables which constantly have waiters and people going to the bathroom whizzing by. The entire time, a private boot (haha! I meant booth, but that's a great typo) sat empty next to us, but we were told it "wasn't available". Lastly, the dessert was expensive but *tiny*. I almost called over the waitress to say are you sure this is what a piece of cheesecake should look like" but judging by our table request, we didn't bother. So, busy, loud space, good pizza, expensive tiny dessert. Lots of our friends love it, so maybe it was just an off day.

I've tried giordano's and pequod's now and I can see why people like both. However, I think I might choose pequod's over giordano's because of the way the crust is made. I liked that the crust was crunchy and the pizza was soft. I created my own toppings when I went and got mushroom, onions, and sausage. Choosing the toppings I think can also make or break the pizza flavors. It seems like this place is always busy so know that there will be a wait. I didn't know this because it was my first time there. But you can call ahead to have your name written down, and once you get there, they will move your name up to the top. So you do still have to wait, but it won't be like an hour. Once you place your order of pizza, know that it will take about an hour to make the pizza. So it's probably a good idea to order appetizer if your starving. I ordered the jalapeño poppers which were fantastic! Recommended to us by our server. It was just me and my bf that was there so we ordered an appetizer and a size small for pizza. Size small has 4 slices but keep in mind that it's a chunky slice. I was able to only eat 1 slice because It's so much going on in just 1 slice.

pics.caption: Slice of mushroom, onion, and sausage
Size small pizza of mushroom, onions, and sausage

review.des: This pizza was just okay!!!  Maybe because it was lunch time!!  My friend and I got the personal pan lunch special.  The pizza need more cheese and more sauce
I had their lunch special once and it was pretty decent. A pizza joint has to be more than pretty decent in Chicago to go back for a second time.
best pizza in Chicago. Order takeaway and take it to the bar across the street, Kibbitznest.

While in Chicago, we were on the hunt for the best deep dish. We only had a chance to try two, so I can't compare Pequod's to all the other deep dishes of Chicago. With so many different places at our disposal, we went with Pequod's because of the solid reviews. Although it wasn't our favorite of the trip, we still thought it was good!

The small (10") was more than enough food for two. It's cool that you can do half toppings here, we loaded it up with veggie toppings for me and meat for the meat eater. I couldn't really taste the cheesy crust, and to be honest prefer Lou Malnati's crust a bit more.

We came at an obscure time and there was no wait. It's a bit of a trek, but it's worth checking out if you're like us and want to check out the best of Chicago.
Best deep dish, pan, Chicago style pizza! Wait is long usually, but they're always friendly.

OMG this place is the REAL OG! I've never had pizza as delicious as this, EVER. Run don't walk to Pequod's. I would literally fly back from Atlanta just to enjoy a pie from here.  Their deep dish pans are old and well seasoned, making the crust taste like absolute heaven.

If I could give this restaurant zero stars I would. My family and I came to the restaurant back in July because a lot of people we spoke to recommended Pequods over Giordano's and Lou Malnati's, let's just say they couldn't be more wrong. The experience from start to finish was one of the worst I've ever had at any restaurant. We waited over 3 hours for a table of 10. At first I didn't mind the wait because we were a large party but by the time it was 12am and we were still waiting it was kind of insane. When they finally called our table we were seated upstairs and while walking upstairs we noticed the entire restaurant was empty. I think maybe one or two parties were left but there were so many tables available i couldn't believe they took so long to seat us. By the time they seated us we put in our order right away and then waited another hour for the pizza, for 4 pies of pizza! At that point we had been waiting for 4 hours, 3 hours to sit then another hour to eat. It was 1230am and I decided to ask one of the waitresses why the pizza was taking so long, she looked up at me and said "don't you see I'm folding boxes, I'm busy, I can't help you." I understand she wasn't our waitress but it wouldn't have been so hard to say "sorry if you give me one second I'll grab your server and she can help you." Anyways, to top it all off, when our pizza finally did come it was the most mediocre of pizzas I've ever had. There was no cheese, the entire pizza was just dough, I wouldn't call it a deep dish or actually a pizza really.

I wouldn't waste time coming to any of their locations. Lou Malnatis and Giordanos were far better in my opinion and there's no sassy waitress folding boxes there.
A delicious Chicago staple and must try place! Pequods never disappoints with its Chicago cheese pizza! The atmosphere really helps tie the whole experience together for a perfect night in Chicago!

All time favorite pizza in the city and maybe even ever... it's amazing! The crust is doughy in the middle and crunchy on the bottom and the caramelized cheese on the edge is the best part. Also has a great cheese and sauce ratio. If you go before 5 you usually don't have to wait but go any later and it can be up to 2 hours BUT you can wait at the bar and get som pre pizza drinks.

pics.caption: Large mushroom onion and garlic zaaaaa

review.des: Good place, really. Comfy room and great service. I can't find a single thing to complain about, but I have a hard time coming up with a big compliment either. The pizza was good, but not exciting. The charred edges of the crust were nice but the dough to toppings ratio here is a little bread heavy for my taste. I enjoyed it and have no complaints, but it's hard to come up with anything that impressed me overall. The people were nice, but not overwhelming. Bottom line, don't be afraid to visit this place. You'll enjoy it. It's a good spot with good people. You probably won't find yourself raving to your friends about it later though.

I've ordered at the restaurant and also have had delivery, both very similar in the quality of food! In my opinion, is superior than Lou Malnati's, Pizzeria Uno, Gina's or Giordano's. Consider delivery if you're in a time rush. From order being placed to pizza arriving to our apartment in Lakeview East - it only took about 1 hour 20 minutes, I was blown away!

I was really excited to try Pequod's after all the hype I've heard since moving back to the city.  Perhaps I'm old fashioned, perhaps I'm no longer hip, but I thought that other than the delicious burned cheese crust - the pizza was just average.  It's certainly not up to the level of many other less-trendy deep dish spots in the city.  I suppose to each his own, but I'm glad to have tried it on day there wasn't much of a wait - If I had waited an hour for pizza like this, I would have been very disappointed.
This may actually be one of the best deep dish places in town. Their caramelized cheese crust really stands out and it stays true to Chicago style deep dish. Great lunch special deals as well.
Best deep dish I've ever had.  Been to a lot of different places but this is the best.  Simply amazing.
There is always an argument about the best Chicago Pizza. Well, this is it. If you are a true Chicagoan you understand that Pequad's is where it's at!

Was recommended to this spot by a Chicago native so I had to try it out. I was told to "not have high expectations" for Chicago deep dish pizza but I was still looking forward to trying it out. We sat upstairs in a booth. Service was honestly... OK. It took a minute for our server to greet us and we weren't really checked on much, until we requested for the check. I really enjoyed the pizza though! Crispy crust and it was soft and hearty with toppings on the top -- I really liked it. Definitely the type of pizza to put you in a coma. I wanted to ask for extra sauce on the side because the pizza is quite bread-y but as I mentioned above, we did not receive much service.

When in Chicago, you gotta go get yourself a deep dish pizza.
You can go for one of the chain restaurants, or you can try a local joint.
The bf and i came here in the afternoon. No wait around 5/6 o'clock.
What sets this place apart from the other pizza joints? The caramelize crust. God that crust was good.
I would have to say, if you like a thick, hardy, toasty crust, tart tomato base, and lots of gooey cheese, then this is the place to go.
THe bf and I ordered the small and it was SO MUCH FOOD. We ended up getting just mushroom, which was a good choice since it didn't end up too oily or overwhelming.
i complete recommend this place and if you can, come for their lunch special. It's like $5 for a personal pizza!

Score!

Hands down, Pequod's is the best Chicago deep dish. Pequod's is always a staple of my Chicago trips. I always try to eat there at least once while I am in town. The first couple times I was in Chicago, I did the touristy thing and went to Giordano's, etc. I did not know about the Holy Grail of Chicago pizza yet. A friend of mine told me I was missing out and needed to stay away from the tourist trap pizza places and experience true Chicago pizza. I had high expectations for my first time when I went to Pequod's, and they definitely were met and exceeded! I was not disappointed. If you go on a weekend, you should expect a wait, unless you utilize the call ahead seating that they offer. The pizza does take some time to make, but it is expected. Their pizza is actually true deep dish pizza, with the perfect combination of dough, sauce, cheese, and toppings. (Instead of having loads of cheese and toppings filled with a thin layer of dough.) I can't even put in words how amazing the flavor is, especially with the caramelized cheese on the crust! That's probably one of my favorite parts!!!

The atmosphere is great inside as well, especially to watch your favorite team. Lots of televisions and you will have a view of multiple screens from wherever you are seated. I was impressed with how reasonable the price was at Pequod's as well.

If you haven't had Pequod's deep dish yet, you need to go try it ASAP. It will change your life and you will not want to eat any other Chicago deep dish ever again.

Got pick up from here last night. Not too bad but the thin crust was a little too doughy for my liking. The pizza had a unique flavor to it which was pretty good. The wings sauce was good but ruined by soggy wings. I wish people wouldnt leave wings submerged in a gallon of hot sauce. It takes a way the crispiness. otherwise this was not a bad first experience

Ok so this review is based on delivery. The pizza is amazing. My favorite pizza in the city. However, delivery is not what it uses to be. I initially called at 6:10pm today to place an order. I followed the prompts and was on hold listening to some awful music for 20 min. 20 minutes. Unreal. Then the music stops, and I get pushed to voicemail! The fact I even stayed on hold that long showcases how much I love this pizza. I call back and decide to choose the pick up prompt, which resulted in me speaking to someone right away. I advised what happened and instead of saying they will look into it, she said she could take my order herself. Had I known this I wouldn't have waited for 20 minutes.

Now the fun part. I got my order taken, was told it would be here in about 1.5 hours (8:05pm). Pizza didn't come until 8:30. That is 2 hours of waiting. That's a bit ridiculous in my opinion. I'm not that far away, there was no rain, and traffic around 8pm isn't really heavy. I ended up calling the store asking if anything had happened because it's been 2 hours. The girl who answered said to call back in 10 minutes if the pizza didn't come. I mean, shouldn't this be addressed at that moment in time, regardless? What is 10 minutes after 2 hours of waiting?!?!? Customer service should have been better. I should have been given to a manager to discuss. Had I known I'd be eating at 8:30pm I would have ordered somewhere else, eaten by 730pm (at a normal hour).

Pizza came lukewarm, not hot. Normally, I would say something, but I was so hungry from not having had anything to eat all day that I just said forget it. They won't do anything anyways- they didn't do anything when I told them I've been waiting over 2 hours and the pizza guy was 30 min late. For the price, I would have expected a little better customer service. I order pizza all the time and come in very frequently, so this experience makes me a little weary of ordering delivery from here. Maybe it's best to go sit at the store, and hope not to be stuck upstairs on the summer where it feels like 100 degrees!

I want to emphasize that I called at 610 in order to beat the rush and be able to get my dinner by 730. Unfortunately, it's 9pm and I just finished. I'll report back if pequods reaches out. I'm not really holdingy breath though.

After trying many pizza joints during my Chicago visit, I really enjoyed Pequod's pan crust deep dish style with the rising dough. Also, their crust had a nice crisp, burnt looking cheese crust along the edges. This was definitely my favorite deep dish style and one of my favorite deep dish pizzas I have had!

pics.caption: Delicious!!! I love the pan crust style.
A slice of their tasty deep dish!! The burnt cheese crust is cool.

review.des: The best pizza in Chicago. The best location is in Morton Grove. If someone tells you Lou Malnatis is the best, than they are a fake and don't understand real pizza. The caramelized crust can't be beat, and you can't go wrong with any of the toppings. Make sure you call in advance because the pizza takes over an hour to cook, and don't worry about ordering too much the leftovers taste even better. Enjoy.

This is by far the best pan pizza in Chicago. I come here every time I have visitors. Every single person loves it. It's a good idea to come during the week for lunch for a shorter wait. Still worth the wait for dinner, however.

This is my favorite pizza joint hands down. You can't beat the price and it's right by the movie theater! The service from the servers is unbeatable. I always feel like family when I come. Thank you pequods!

Pequod's defines what deep dish pizza should be. This is a must-do when our friends come in from out of town...and after we take them once, they request it every time they come back. The crust...THE CRUST!!! It's kind of burnt but not...look, I don't know what they do or how they do it but the crust is to die for! From the quality of the ingredients, to the cozy atmosphere and the great service...you really can't go wrong!

The pizza is ok and the service was horrible. The wait for our pizza was almost two hours, so long that we had to order an appetizer after waiting 45 minutes because it was so long, I guess not a bad idea to get you to spend more money. The restaurant was not what I would consider clean, looked like it had not be renovated since it opened. Don't expect to much and you won't be disappointed, but this would not be on my top list of 5 pizza places to visit in Chicago!

If you're a fan of deep dish pizza this is a must! Line goes outside though on weekends. Mad busy! Definitely need a bigger location. Service is fair space itself is like any other old restaurant. Cheers
The best thing about the pizza is the dough (a little overrated, Malnati's is still better in my book). Great hang out place, good location and good food/service.

We came here on recommendation from friends that this was the best deep dish in the city. Better than Lou Malnati's or Giordano's. We ordered a pizza to go because the wait was over an hour and it's too crowded to wait inside and not a great waiting space. I was sorely disappointed by the deep dish and it was the worst deep dish I have had. The crust was really dry and there was a few dollops of cheese but mostly dry bread with sauce. I'm not sure if it was an off night since it seems like most people seem to like it, but definitely not what I expected. I would like to try it again to see if it was just a bad pie, but don't want to end up like last time. I will definitely update my review next time I try. I prefer Lou's and Giordano's at this point.

I loved the pizza and wings we had at Pequod's. I was visiting in town with some friends and we felt very welcome and enjoyed the food and beer together. We had a great experience! I will say that their furniture is a little older so the atmosphere gets a 3/5 from me but overall the service and quality of the food was great! Happy with our experience!

If you want local deep dish, this is your spot. Voted the best among everyone I know and the perfect place to bring out of town guests. We have friends who look forward to coming here every time they visit. Grab a drink because you will most likely have a wait.

No gluten free options here but if you are with a big group, you can get one of their salads which are pretty solid.

We got here on a Saturday night around 6-7 PM. There was about an hour or so wait. Meanwhile, we luckily got a spot at the bar and enjoyed some beers and the Blackhawks game.

Finally, it was time to eat. We got the deep dish pizza with caramelized crust. Pizza was pretty delicious, but the crust is what made it unique. I've pretty much had the best of the best when it comes to deep dish, but this place is right up there. It's hard to be blown away when you've had the best, but there was definitely no denying that the pizza and experience is worth the trip.

An incredible authentic Chicago style pizza place.  The slices were incredible and the atmosphere was textbook pizza joint.  The wait staff could use a little hospitality, but the food more than made up for it.

hmmm... i don't know.  either we went on an off night, or this place is supremely hyped up.  i honestly don't know if we went on an off night, because people were waiting outside to be seated.  

long story short, it took over an hour to get our pizza, and once the pizza arrived, the bottom was burnt and there was not enough cheese. maybe i'm holding this place to such a high standard, but i should right??? Michelin recommend this place, and you know if they recommend it... it has to be good.
the crust and bread holding the pizza was just too thick and the sauce was kinda lacking.  the price for a small pizza is roughly 12 bucks, and toppings are an extra 2 bucks.  

not to mention, parking is almost impossible to find on the streets, so you'll have to park across the street at he movie theater lot for 10 bucks. =/

i was going in with high hopes, but this place fell short of them.

For 15 years I have gotten great takeout pizza from Pequods.

Last night my wife and I chose to actually eat in at the restaurant. It was not at all crowded (that is unusual) but a large sign at the greeter's table warned of a 40 minute wait (at least) if you dared order pizza -deep dish or thin crust.  The greeter did say we could get slices in ten minutes.

Slices came in about 20 minutes burned up and singed. 1/2 order of spaghetti ordered with cheese came quickly with a mountain of cheese burying a tiny bit of spaghetti and a small single meatball (for $2.95 additional). Unrecognizable as a small spaghetti dinner.

One of the worst  restaurant meals I've  ever had!

We'll go back to ordering take out pizza from Pequods.
Not a fan. I like deep dish pizza, just not Pequod's crust. It is a biscuit like dough and very dry and crumbly in my opinion. Caramelized cheese was nice but not enough to compensate.

After hearing so much about this place, I wouldn't really rank it that high on my list of favorite pizzas. We went around 11:15, and it wasn't too busy. The pizza was good, and the lunch special is an amazing deal, but it wasn't anything spectacular. The wait was around 45 minutes and pizza is super doughy and doesn't have much cheese, and I would have expected the "caramelized crust" that they are known for to be more than just the edges. The servers weren't the friendliest either, so it's not really somewhere I would choose to go back to. But it was an OK lunch.

This place is quintessential Chicago.   Wow.  I loved it so much.  The pizza was great "college" style... but for those of us with a bit of a honed taste.. probably a bit to much sauce.   Anyway.. .just my opinion, but.. overall.. excellent.  And great for a 1st date!

My boyfriend and I came to pequods the first night we arrived in Chicago.  It was our first time trying deep dish pizza so we were very excited and very hungry. We had high expectations for this place and for the deep dish pizza itself. Thankfully we sat down right away and didn't have to wait in line. We ordered our pizza and the waitress told us it would take about 45 minutes for the pizza to come out....  :( we were really hungry so we ordered some mozzarella sticks to munch on while we waited. Finally the pizza came out and we were ready to dig in.
To be honest, my boyfriend and I were quite disappointed. Idk what we were expecting but it sure didn't meet up to it. It wasn't horrible but it just wasn't great.
I ended up only eating one slice (only because I was hungry) and my boyfriend forcefully ate two slices.

Maybe we will give it a try again next time

Nice little spot to drop by after a drink filled night in Wicker Park. Stopped by to grub on some deep dish when we found out they close at 2 AM. I was pleasantly surprised that it resembled more of a dive bar than a pizzeria. Being on vacation in Chicago and being that it was my last night, I had to have me some Deep Dish Deliciousness. Unknown to me, they served pizza by the slices, which was to come out a lot faster if you didn't want to wait for a deep dish. Did my inebriated self want to wait an hour for a deep dish? Sadly, my impatience got the better of me.

I went with a simple slice of pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom pizza while my girlfriend wanted a white pesto pizza. The server told us my order wouldn't be a problem to make for a slice but we'll have to order a a full pizza for my gf's order. Not a problem...if my slice didn't take as long as her mini white pesto deep dish to come out. What was probably 35 minutes, my slice finally came out.

Perfect size for my hungry drunk ass and loaded with toppings. It was better than I expected. My only gripe? The sauge, or shall we call them meat balls, were a little too big and over powering, making the pepperoni and mushroom irrelevant. Luckily, them balls were packed with flavor. Just wish they were smaller in size so I can taste the other toppings. Not before I was 1/4 through my pizza, my gf's pizza came out. If I knew my slice would take almost as long as my gf's order I would've just went with a classic deep dish.

We rarely got checked on and had to wave down the servers a couple times to get water refills. Besides that, the servers were very friendly. If we ever stop by Chicago again, I'd definitely like to try what people are saying is the best deep dish in Chicago.

It is a nice cozy neighborhood Pizzeria.  I have lived in Chicago most of my life and can say that I have frequented many, many other establishments.   We ordered a thin pepperoni large pizza which was tasty.  It arrived in a timely manner.  The service was ok.  The staff is mainly female (at least from what I could see that day).  We sat at the bar because my out of town friend was starving and did not want to wait a minute longer.  I was surprised that on this particular night (weeknight) it was not busy at all.  The female staff seemed to be more interested in talking to my male friend which I found to be very disrespectful and unprofessional.  Luckily, this is a friend otherwise he would have been replaced very quickly if he was a significant other.  Like I said, the attention was toward him that I did not even or was asked if I wanted any water.  The bar area where we sat was dirty and sticky and no one bothered to even wipe it down.  It gave me a sick feeling so I barely touched or leaned up against it.  I took a few bites of the pizza which I said was tasty.  I guess my friend could tell that I was unhappy by the look on my face that decided to eat as fast as he could and leave the place.  
If I were to order pizza from this place again I would definitely order it to go.  Parking was not difficult to find, but with so many other pizza joints in this great city, it will be a while before I head over to this place and order their famous pizza.

Probably the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Visited Chicago and had to visit this place. Waited about 1.5 hours for a party of 2 on a Saturday night. I wish that they'd allow ordering before seating so that it's ready the the time the table is. Sadly, it takes 45 minutes from time of ordering to receiving the pizza. But it is so worth it! The caramelized crust makes it a masterpiece. Definitely visiting again when I'm in town
Amazing pizza. The bar/front staff could be friendlier but honestly the pizza was so good I barely cared.

Pequod's is one of my favorite Chicago deep dish pizzas.  The crust is caramelized and crispy, and the pizza simply hits the spot.  I usually go plain cheese, because I'm a simple guy.  Wait times can be long, but I guess that's a good thing?

We stopped in after a Cubs game on a Saturday around 515 place wasn't that crowded we got a seat right away . The inside is small and hot . The pizza was good , not amazing like I have read . They have a ton of workers with Pequods shirts on walking around , and multiple girls came back to check on us and refill our drinks . So we weren't really sure who our server was . Very small menu , but we went for the deep dish pizza . It was a nice Saturday dinner in the city, if we are in the area again we will stop by .
They do have a call ahead seating option , your not guaranteed to be seated right away but if they are busy I would do this option on the way there . I also heard if you order a pickup and decide to stay and eat they seat you fairly quickly.

There is street parking (which is hard to get ) but also a Parking garage across the street .

Loved it! I think it's a tie between Pequod's and Giordano's for me. It's everything you'd expect if you're craving the usual deep dish pizza. Giordano's is more of a "fancy" deep dish in my opinion. While Pequod's focuses more on the crust, Giordano's is more about the toppings and cheese (which can be overwhelming and super rich). Both are great.

I liked the atmosphere on the 2nd floor. Seemed like a dive bar.
I'm surprised they don't have more locations in the downtown area!
Love coming here for pizza. But the wait for a table is extremely long and ridiculous. Maybe getting a bigger spot? Besides that pizzas good and staff is very nice as well!
I know they're known for their "awesome" deep dish; however, I don't really like it. I prefer the thin crust. It has a great taste. This place is always busy.
Great pizza if you enjoy Chicago deep dish. This is more of a pan pizza but the caramelized crust is what sets it apart from the rest.

Placed order at 2:45pm for a 5pm delivery. They lost the order. New delivery time was by 6pm. Called at 6:15 to check in. The pizza had "just come out of the oven". The pizza just got here at 7:39pm.

LITERALLY 2 HOURS AND 39 MINUTES AFTER STATED DELIVERY TIME.

By far the worst pizza delivery experience of my life. Very very disappointed by Pequods. Will never order takeout from them again.

Forget Giordano's, forget Home Run Inn, forget Lou Malnati's, forget Gino's East. Pequod's puts them all to shame. Hands-down, best pizza I've ever had. There's usually a massive wait (especially during Cubs games), and pizzas take an hour to cook, but it is absolutely worth it. The sauce is rich and spicy, and the crust has the perfect amount of crunch to it. Don't get it delivered, though. It completely alters the texture of the crust to a mushy substance. If you do have to get it delivered, order it uncut, and throw it in a hot oven for a few minutes to firm the crust back up. The one thing they could do better is their delivery system. They're very unaccommodating with their delivery zone, and it can take over two hours to get your food. (I've been told by a driver that they keep a short staff of drivers.)

Pequod's was recommended from a co-worker who knows my love for pizza. Unfortunately I'm not a huge fan of their caramelized crust. I enjoy eating the crust, but this was not an option for their pan pizza. I will say the cooks are very heavy handed on the pepperoni toppings, which was definitely well received!
Man, got some soggy deep dish tonight. Bottom was literally soaking wet. I had to throw the pizza in my oven for 30 minutes. Gross

Enjoyed the pizza. Seemed a little over cooked not just "caramalized" but for the price and service I would definitely recommend this place to someone wanting deep dish and not looking to break the bank

My first real chicago deep dish pizza! We walked in a few minutes after they open, and there were already a few customers inside... a good sign.

Took about an hour which is reasonable, so we ordered a half order of fries to keep us entertained (yum and cheap). A "small" pizza has only 4 slices but is definitely enough to feed two people.

That delicious smell of freshly made pizza, the cheese string lasting forever, the toppings are big and juicy. and stuffed at capacity. The crust is solid... crispy crunchy almost cookie like. The sides are baked with caramelized cheese and is almost 4 inches high. Very satisfying.

Staff was friendly and was great at helping us customize our perfect pizza!

This place is full of it.  They screwed me over with my take out order.  Lied and said they would make it right with a credit.  When I  called to redeem  the credit didn't exist.  I will never do business with them again.  I don't pay the get screwed.  BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!!!!

After seeing this quaint little spot on three different shows, we had to make the trek while in Chicago! The crunchy cheese crust around the pizza is superb and also  the best part. If your into the deep dish or have never had it, it's definitely different and unique; this east coast gal likes NY style or Detroit style( if ever in Pittsburgh I'll show you the best Detroit style). Appreciate the uniqueness and the fact that it's different from regular Chicago deep dish.
Wasn't a huge fan of the pizza. Took 1.5 to get us on a weekday. We only live about a mile away or so. Topping were pretty good, but the crust is just weird. I would say try once.

The first time I was here, there was no wait (we came super late on a weekday). This was a few years ago while on vacation, but it was SO good that I remembered it. Fast forward to the present, I had to go back and again, it was soooo goood. Waited about 30min this time but still worth it. Definitely a must eat in Chicago. I've also had Giordano's and it was mediocre. If you're going to try deep dish then you gotta try Pequod's!
I will not eat pepperoni pizza unless it's from here! The service, vibes and food is great. Even delivery is great. When friends and I go out for pizza this is always the place for our group.

The veggie pan pizza was just okay in my opinion. It wasn't bad and it wasn't great. I personally didn't care for the taste of the tomato sauce. As others noted, there was too much crust with respect to the toppings/cheese. Although the crust did taste decent. The quality of the veggie toppings was meh. And lastly I was not a fan of the caramelized crust. I appreciate them trying to do something a little bit different, but it just came across as weird. At the end of the day, there are other deep dish restaurants I prefer. I'm glad I checked this out though.

Best deep dish pizza I've tried in Chicago!

It's a little outside of downtown, but it's worth the drive or cab ride. I prefer Pequods anyday over Gino's and Giordanos.

Tip- They do call aheads which saves a lot of time since this place gets packed.

Deep dish pizza, yum! I came here with a friend on a weekend for lunch around 11:30AM, and there was no wait. There was a wait, however, for the pizza to come out; I hear it's pretty typical though. We ordered a small pizza with spinach, mushroom, bell pepper, and pepperoni. The sauce wasn't very flavorful and towards the middle, the crust got soggy. For the most part though when the pizza first came out, the bottom of the crust was crunchy which was nice! I really enjoyed it. The outer crust was my favorite part though; it was a bit burnt and it was super crunchy and delicious! Good place to eat, I would definitely recommend it. The bill came out to be around $11 post-tax, which I don't know whether is typical or not for deep dish. Delicious though!

When I called ahead I was told that they would not put the pizza in until we were here. I thought, wow they must deal with a lot of sketchy people. Then when we got here they told us that the pizza won't be started until we were seated. It took 15 minutes for them to seat us. They put us upstairs where they have one waitress for 20 tables. They let us know that the pizza would be 40 minutes. We have been here an hour. Our waitress came to the table and apologized that they "lost" our order and that it will be an additional 20 minutes. The waitress just came to ask if we wanted to order additional food! Um, no, we'd not like to spend more money here! We'd like what we called ahead for.

You're not a true Chicagoan if you haven't had Pequods's. Their deep dish is amazing. If you are going to eat in, get there at an off time as they are usually very busy during dinner and lunch hours. We frequent delivery and it is still hot when it arrives. YUM!

Went to this place after Cubs game- here's my first impression as I walked in- DIRTY! Staff looked exhausted although it was end of night. Pizza wait was 40 minutes although person at bar said he had been waiting over an hour... not that many people in restaurant, maybe heavy carry out causing wait time? I had a Italian sausage, with sweet peppers. Ok this may possibly have been the worst Italian sausage I've ever had- it resembled beef jerky- the peppers, nearly raw- warmed up is how I would describe- bread was way to big not a sausage roll- friend had meatball sandwich, as I write this it's 7:30 am 8.5 hours later and he's puking- the meatball sandwich was ridiculous- it looked like they started making a pizza then realized it was a sandwich? I know this is a pizza place first but come on if you mess up a simple sandwich how good can the pizza be? I mean seriously. My guess this place is frequented by people right out of college that were eating Dominos pizza for the past 5 years in college. The older group probably ate there years ago wandered in and realized the pizza wasn't as good as they thought. My guess is that if any of you 4 star reviewers took a tour of that kitchen you'd drive straight to Cosco to buy a pallet of toilet paper cause you'll surely need it.. I agree that Lou's is way ahead of this place-oven grinder another good place as I remember although haven't been there in a while, might feel the same way- I like well lit restaurants that don't have a wad of gum sitting on bar when I sit down. Maybe I hit this place on a bad night- I doubt it though... The bartender was very nice, she gladly took our money with a big smile-

Now that I've tried most of this city's popular pizza joints, I feel like I can put each one into their own category. By far Giordano's is still my favorite because they have a fierce gooey cheese game going on in their pies. Lou's tends to be more saucy, while here we found it to be overly bready.

On our first visit we tried the thin crust which we enjoyed, so we were very excited to get their famous deep dish with an all cheese crust, which is phenomenal by the way. Who knew burnt cheese could taste so good?

The pizza seemed to be a good inch of bread high with a layer of sauce and toppings as opposed to more of a deep dish where the bottom layer of dough is thinner and the toppings deeper and more plentiful.

It still tastes great sure, but everyone has a preference. My husband likes Lou's the best which is why we were hoping to have this be our new favorite and could that way compromise and eat here when we were in town.

I like that it has the feel of a local sports bar and the service was stellar. Our waitress comped one of my husband's beers for taking a long time to come out when we hadn't even noticed or brought it up which I thought was completely awesome and unnecessary.

Still do come here and try it to decide for yourself which pizza suits your fancy. The toppings are fresh, the flavors on point, and you certainly won't leave hungry! They also have great lunch specials and you can call ahead and put your name down during high wait times.

pics.caption: Mostly bread with a layer of sauce and toppings

review.des: In a town know for deep dish and never changing the deep dish prerequisites, Pequod's stands out for making a great pie while diverging from the run of the mill pie's you'll find elsewhere. Easily taking the crown as my favorite Chicago deep dish, Pequod's excels exactly where the others, in my own humble opinion, have failed: refreshing a Chicago staple. The pies are deep but not so much that one slice fills you up. The crust is perfectly golden brown but allows the toppings to take top billing. If Pequod's wanted to improve, the only recommendation I could proffer is to open another location or expand their delivery radius to River North!!

Just how do they do it?  How does this place achieve deep dish pizza perfection?

After some research, I found out some of the secrets.  First is the cast iron pizza pans, well-seasoned after many years of use.  Next is the dough, spread in a thick layer on the bottom of the oiled pizza pain, but not up the sides.  The cheese is whole mild mozzarella, sliced in house to exact specifications, and laid in overlapping pattern on top of the crust but, and here's one of the secrets, also placed up on the sides of the pan.  A hefty ladle of uncooked seasoned tomato sauce goes on top, followed by toppings, dried oregano and pecorino romano cheese.  The thing bakes for about 20 minutes in a 600 degree oven.  

The result?  The crust has a beautiful lacy caramelized ring around it, the sauce is sweet and tangy with great depth of flavor, and the toppings are charred to great effect.

It's deep dish pizza perfection!  Hard. To. Stop. Eating. It.

The only downside is that it's busy and the wait is long.  On a rainy Saturday at 1:30 pm, we waited about 45 minutes to get in, and then it took another 45 minutes to get our pizza after we sat down.  Don't fret, your patience will be rewarded!

The atmosphere was nice and so were the employees, however the thin crust pizza slices I ordered were over priced for what I received. This pizza does not adhere to the standards I hold Chicago pizza to. If you are high as a kite and need some warm food in your belly before you sack out then this joint could be for you. The staff, atmosphere and late night hour is what this place has going for it but you want to go here for a slice of pizza(it's in the name) for a comparable price. I would not recommend to others.

Absolutely amazing pizza!  Crust was incredibly crispy and that caramelized cheese...drool...

We actually didn't have to wait long for a table on a Friday night (Tip: use their priority wait seating on their website!  It's not really a reservation but they'll put you on the front of their wait list once you arrive).

Looking for deep dish pizza. This is your spot.

Divey but authentic Pequods pumps out delivery and in house pizzas. Service is accommodating and eager to please although their busy. Best luck at no wait is off hours or before 5PM.

Loved it but had to give it 3 stars based on the wait, dark/dive atmosphere and fact that they don't mix your salads because people complained about the amount of dressing used...? Like what?

Beware of Cubs games because overflow tends to find itself there after games.

This place is overtly rated to be one of the best pizza   In Chicago.  I had to see it for myself.  If you are coming here on an empty stomach you better pack a SNACK box because you are going to be WAITING a very LONG TIME to be waited On.  
We had a very nice waitress she gave us her suggestions we like the appetizers very much.  Nice and hot.   The pizza to me was not like WOW best pizza no. I did not care for it because it lack seasoning and the dough was not well done for me and I needed to add salt on my pizza.  I never add salt to my food but yes the pizza was under salted.  

The only thing that I totally disliked were the hostesses.  The one that had glasses was loosing control and was yelling at all of us to get into a single file and had to be helped to mange the buzzers you received to be called to your table.  After over an biy and half we finally got our table they took us upstairs and a hostess with braids was so rude she was taking us so fast up the stairs my cldey sick mother was exhausted and could not catch up to her.  So by the time we got sited at our table the hostess rudely slam the forks, knives in a cup on the table and walked off.   That ruin my appetite.  Set the ambiance from 5 states to 3

No am definitely NOT coming back not worth the wait

Closer location than the original to downtown of my favorite Chicago deep dish pizza.

Food: 5, Atmosphere: 3, Service: 4
Cost to worth it rating: 4 ($22 for 1 topping large pan pizza)
Return worthiness: yes

Highlights:
- Caramelized crust: their differentiator
- Toppings: they have meatball (liked this a lot), Italian beef, and giardiniera and top it with lots of gooey melty cheese
- Garlic bread: solid to munch on while you wait
- Serve the full menu until 2am
- Full bar
- $5 lunch special: includes personal pizza and a soda

Midlights:
- No specialty pizzas: you gotta make up your own

Lowlights:
- Bit of a car ride to get to from downtown

Still love this pie and will be back.

pics.caption: Close up view on a delectable hot and delicious topping filled slice
Went for meatball, sausage, peppers and onions (with mushrooms on half) SO good. My favorite Chicago deep dish

review.des: My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago! The burnt crust is absolutely delicious. It's a place that I would love to be able to make a reservation, but it is worth the wait. Whenever I go to another pizza place, I find myself wishing that the crust tasted more like Pequod's. Deep dish is not something you can have every day, but whenever I do have it this is the only one I think is worth the unimaginable level of fullness I experience when done eating!
Great! Just don't come in when you're already starving- deep dish takes 45min-1hour.

My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago.  Pequod's is a whale of a good time.  This pizza is legit they don't Moby Dick around with the quality.  Great place for a date night, slam a couple pizzas and let the romance commence!

First time I had their burnt crust years ago, I wasn't so much of a fan.  Lately I have had it a couple times and find it very unique and addicting.  Friendly service, good unique chicago style pizza.  Definitely recommend trying it out.

It's a shame what a little bit of fame and popularity can do to a place. Have been going to Pequod's for years because they have the absolutely best pizza.  In the past, execution and customer service has been good. (See my review from 4 years ago...).  Unfortunately, the last 3 times I have been to Pequod's my order has been totally screwed up - and the worst part, THEY DON'T CARE.  Lack of any concern for customer experience and never expressing any sincere apology from the invisible management has finally driven me (party of 9) away for good.   They have made it abundantly clear they have enough business and don't need mine.  There are other decent pizza places who will APPRECIATE my business in the future.

Went here for Lunch. I was very excited to try the deep dish here as I had heard it was the best in Chicago. I've always been a Gino's East fan myself. Ordered ahead and used the text service to expedite our meal. The pizza came out within the time they said, however it was soggy and watery. The sauce was not seasoned at all and the pizza at all was flavorless. However, the one fantastic part of the pizza was the caramelized cheese crust which was delicious. Rest of the pizza was awful. Thankfully, the server spoke to the manager and they took the pizza off our bill. Unfortunately, both me and my companion got food poisoning from the single slices we ate. I will try Pequods again as I'm hoping it was just our bad luck that our pizza was terrible.

I went on Sunday with some friends and the waiting was wait too long. We asked our pan pizza to go because we though that it would take less time that if we wait for a table at the restaurant. But it wasn't like that. They told us that we had to wait for 1:15 hours, and we were waiting there for 2 hours. It was really frustrating because they were telling us that they were checking our order, but they were not doing it. Finally, one of the workers appeared 45 minutes later than our original waiting time with our order and other 10 more orders. Our biggest surprise was that when we arrived home 5 minutes later and we ate the pizza it was not that good like if you eat it in the restaurant. The crust wasn't crunchy like it should be, and the pizza was kind of cold. We use to go to this restaurant a lot to eat the best pan pizza in Chicago, but now I don't know if we will come back.

This was pretty good. I can see why people like the carmelized crust, but I'm a big fan of the flaky crust pizza.

I was glad that the wait was not too long and that we were seated within 20 minutes.
Good pizza. Interesting concept. Not deep dish though. Lou's or Giordanos is the way to go.
A bit overrated. It was a long wait for our pizza, and when we got it the crust was burnt.

Our server Angela was fantastic!! She was able to accommodate our group and was able to split all of our receipt!! Thank you Angela!!

We all had their deep dish Chicago Style Pizza! It was a mix comment, but overall not bad. you would have to know what Chicago deep dish pizza is about, otherwise, you might find it interestingly different!!

I would've taken photos, but our whole group worked the whole day for more than 16 hours and by 10:30pm, we were all exhausted and just ready to just dive in and eat!! LOL

Overall, I'd recommend coming here and be one of the locals!!

Until then, Cheers!! ~ :p

My first Chicago style deep dish pizza did not disappoint! The place is pretty divey and unapologetically so. Since the pizza itself was going to take about 30-40 minutes, we ordered their cheese bread to start. The cheese bread is almost artery clogging with the amount of cheese that they put on it and was the perfect size to share between three people without being too much.

We ordered a pepperoni, sausage, and basil pizza. The crust came out looking like it was burnt but it was just how they caramelized cheese. The crust itself was very crispy on the outside while fluffy and doughy on the inside. The addition of the caramalized/burnt cheese was definitely my favorite part of the pizza and was quite addicting! The pepperoni was pretty standard and I liked their sausage a lot better because it was more flavorful. The only real downside is that the pizza was mainly a really thick crust. Though it was tasty, I could only really get through one whole slice before being sent into a carb-induced food coma. Once we got over the intial wow-factor of the crispy cheese, we mainly picked away at the toppings of our next slices.

Overall, I think Pequod's was a great introduction to Chicago deep dish for me and I can't wait to try other spots to be able to compare!

Fast service. Pizza was tidy and tasty. Wait staff was pushy about us packing up leftovers, paying a bill, and leaving. We hadn't even finished eating or drinking our drinks. I understand the effort to get more bums on seats, but I felt rushed and wholly undervalued.

I may the only person in this city that is not a huge fan of pequod's pizza. It's ok, but nothing to drool over. Wait to usually too long for average pizza. If you want great Chicago pizza, go elsewhere. Pequod's is all hype.

Chicago is the land of deep-dish pizza. And I can't stand it. The only time I would ever get deep-dish was when I had a friend in from out of town. Ever since I discovered the deliciousness that is Pequod's, it's not just the only pizza place I take friends too, it's where I like to go whenever I'm in the mood for a really good pizza pie. It's not deep dish. It's deep-pan pizza so, while the pizza is two inches thick, most of that is crust instead of normal deep dish sludge. And the caramelized crust is amazeballs.

I was surprised how divey it felt when I first walked in but I like that they let their food speak for itself. The cheesy garlic bread is a solid starter, and they typically have pretty good drink specials. I've actually never had to wait too long to get seated, but I've also usually been able to avoid prime dinner time. The one time I had to wait at all, I was able to grab a drink at the bar next door while I waited for my buzzer, so no harm no foul.

One of the best pizzas in Chicago. Deep dish is fantastic. Hands down better then Gino's East and Giordanos .   Great flavor, only thing I don't like is how long the wait is to always get a pizza. I guess that means it's fresh though !
Love this place. Super easy to pick up pizza on my way home today as it always is. Pizza is a unique style and the burnt crust is addictive.

I don't understand the hype of this place.

Super small, so it was obviously over crowded.
The staff all seemed to be either stoned or off of some other stuff I don't even know of.
And honestly, the pizza wasn't even THAT good.

Save yourself the experience, and don't go here.
Chicago in a pizza! Great drafts too. Seating is downstairs and upstairs. Quick with the drinks. Takes a few for the pizza. Worth the wait. Thanks guys!
Food was okay, nothing to go crazy about.. but the service was terrible. Won't make it a point to come back.

A huge disappointment.

There was wait which I don't understand why when majority of the second floor was empty; we were seated upstairs.

What is up with people and deep dishes? I was excited to travel to Chicago to finally try the famous deep dish pizza and that was a huge mistake; the grumpy guy that sat across me couldn't agree any less.

We had the small pan pizza with onion, pepper, mushroom, basil, pineapple and some other greens. It wasn't bad looking but the taste...he finished his slice and I couldn't even stuff another bite. I think I ate a total of 2.5 bites of my slice and doggie bagged the rest for my mommie. Mom didn't like it either.

We also ordered the appetizer combo that came with mozzarella sticks, zucchini slices, jalapeño poppers, and breaded mushrooms. I was super excited for the mozzarella sticks because I can't remember how old I was when I had it; probably in high school. I can't say it fulfilled my craving for mozzarella sticks but it was definitely one of the better appetizers. Everything else was being ingested out of hunger.

We also ordered the garlic bread and wow were we upset. It wasn't garlicy or buttery.

Hmm. This is a tough review. I feel like it's suppose to be good but I had such a bad experience with the food.
I ate here once with six beautiful and accomplished women and one guy named Clarence. Food to notch, service excellent. Picky Pizza eaters will not be disappointed.

Pequods was my first deep dish experience in Chicago, and the only way I can describe it is good enough. We got a small 10-inch pizza with sausage and pepperoni, which paired with a side of fries was the perfect amount for two hungry dudes.

The pizza takes about 40 minutes to come out, so I recommend ordering right away. The cheese is crispy, the toppings are on point, and the crust requires a fork and knife for sure.

I do really like the atmosphere, which is like a cool locals bar. Not as touristy as the Lou Malnati's in downtown Chicago. That gives it a slight edge in the comparison, but the pizza comes down to whether you like a crispier or slightly softer pie.

Great place. Went here for a birthday party. My food took a little while to get to my table, and our waitress kept assuring us multiple times that the wings would be ready soon, but it took about 30 minutes from the first time she said that. So service might be slow here sometimes, but mind you it was kind of busy at that time.

I don't get the hype....I found Pequod's totally overrated. Full disclosure: not a hater of deep dish, but strongly prefer thin crust. Regardless, I did not find the pizza that tasty. Didn't like the biscuity quality to the crust and didn't think the sauce, pepperoni or sausage was that tasty. I'm not going to advertise for other pizza joints in this review, but there is much better pizza to be had in Chicago. I did like the carmelized cheese on the crust, but this barely tasted like pizza to me, it was like some generic Italian-ish pot pie w/out enough garlic/herbs/flavor. All it was was filling. I tried it, it did nothing to make deep dish more appealing to me.

omfg! lost for words..... just go try it!

nuff said!!!!

Originally from Chicago I've had many of the Deep Dish Pizza's from several of the popular and less popular places in Chicagoland.  Lou Malnati's has always been my favorite go to pie for years.  Until now, there was no competition IMHO.  Recommended by a city Lyft driver, great reviews on Yelp and other references, we decided to try Pequod's. We (all five of us who are all long time Deep Dish fans) were NOT disappointed.

Great pie! The crust, the ingredients including the sausage and cheese are top quality. The sauce is excellent with a slight tangy while the acidity is low and cooked out.

Going forward when visiting "My Kind of Town", I'll now have pan pizza on two different nights. One night at Lou's and one night at Pequad's  (not necessarily in that order).  Expect to wait during peak hours but it's worth the effort! Very reasonably priced as well!

I am not a big fan of deep dish pizza, but Peqoud's is pretty damn good. The crust is excellent, caramelized deliciousness; and the toppings are always fresh and plentiful. The service is excellent, and the background music always has me singing along, to my friends chagrin. I don't get here often enough. I love Lou Malnati's, but Peqoud's is a very close second. I adore this place.

I've tried out two other pizza spots in Chicago while traveling here for a few days and this is the best! I would come back here again for their cheese pan pizza which is what I got. They have a lunch special during the weekdays from 11:00am to 3pm for $4.95 so I would recommend ordering that. You can get a personal pan pizza with a fountain drink for the price, which is very reasonable. The quantity is sufficient too for one person but you can even share it. My friends and I ordered an extra one to go as well.

Hahahah, Pequods.

You like deep dish? You like this place.

I think the overly-detailed bad reviews are hilarious. This is not burger king. You do not get it your way. You get it Pequods way, and sometimes, you have to just take it that way.

But I am not here to talk about how long it took to get my food, nor if the server was rude to me, or if your box had a dent in it.

I am here to talk about how the food put in front of me was, which is really what we should all be talking about.

My favorite deep dish pizza ever. You just can't beat Peaquod's: quality ingredients, good sauce/cheese/toppings ratio, and the perfect level of char. I know the charred aspect isn't a favorite for everyone, but I think it completes the pizza and makes it into the perfect Pequod's crust. I've been here several times and the service is kind of hit or miss, but fortunately for them, their pizza is so good that I keep coming back regardless. If you're coming in from out of town and you want deep dish, THIS IS IT. Also try your fav topping with giardinera (spicy food lovers only)... thank me later. :)

It was a new experience for me to tell people all across the city that I'd had pizza, and when they asked "where at" I said "Pequod's" and the response was *universal* approval. "You won't find better in the city. Good job." It was almost as if people were surprised that I, some guy from Vegas, would be able to divine the local secrets of Chicago pizza. This place was awesome.

That's the important part. Second most important: you're going to wait for it. We put our names in and went down the street to a bar they had partnered with to wait, instead of just sitting around waiting for a table in the actual restaurant. They gave us a buzzer and we started drinking. About 80 minutes later, the buzzer went off and we headed back to our table.

We ordered garlic cheese bread for starters, and it was pretty good. I'd give it 4 stars if I had to grade the bread alone. It was still good, no doubt, the bread could have been a bit better if I had to pick one thing to improve.

After we ordered our pizzas, one thick and one thin crust, we waited again and ate our garlic cheese bread and drank our drinks.

The pizzas arrived. I'm not a big fan of Chicago-style deep dish. I consider myself a thin-crust man. The thin crust is thicker than I expected, more of a "pan" style, "normal" thickness. The deep dish was exactly what I expected. Even though I'm not a deep dish person, I ate two pieces and had to stop myself from having a third lest I leave no room for the thin crust. The thin crust was excellent, and the thickness was deceiving: it was crisp and delicious even though a bit airy. I am a big fan of both these pizzas.

The toppings tasted great, the sauce was great, the service was pretty good. I'd come here again in a heartbeat. And I understand why everybody was so happy for me when I told them I'd come here.

The best deep dish pizza in Chicago! We actually had it recommended to us by someone who lived there and we were very impress.  This isn't a big place so the wait can be a little long but worth the wait!

Well, this was a flat-out disappointment.

I'd been hearing great things about Pequod's for years:  Hell, since before I even knew Yelp existed.  Now, I'm no Chicago deep-dish junkie--the dreadful Chicago-style place in my hometown kept me away from the stuff for years--but I've now visited the city enough times to have had several of these pizzas that I thought were terrific.  From what I gathered over time, Pequod's was supposed to be one of the two or three best.  

To judge by the pie we had on this night, it fell sadly short of expectations.  

The crust:  One-dimensionally crunchy and virtually flavorless.
The sauce:  Insipid and bland.
The veggie toppings:  Hacked up in unpleasantly large bites.  (The sausage was pretty good, though.)
That heralded caramelized crust was pretty great, but it could not make up for the rest of this mediocrity of a pizza.

Maybe this was just a dud, a bad night.

We liked everything else about Pequod's:  The casual, cramped, old-school feel of the place; the friendly, if somewhat relaxed, service; the solid Italian salad we shared as an appetizer (very good housemade dressing); and the beer list.

One day, I'd like to give Pequod's another shot.
By far the best deep dish in Chicago. I've been here multiple times and never was let down by the food or service.
Not as good as the hype! It's OK, but I'm not a big fan of golf ball size sausage and very little sauce. I will stay with Nancy's deep dish  or Aurelio's thin crust any day !
Decided to check it out once I read a couple reviews . Great pizza . Couldn't even finish the personal pan pizza

I came here on a Saturday, and it was packed! When we got there, there was a wait, but we were able to grab a drink at their associated bar two doors down. We had one drink there before our table was ready. We had the cheesy garlic bread and created our own pizza. The cheesy garlic bread was great, and while I am not the biggest fan of deep dish pizza, it was still some of the best that I have had!
It would have been nice if they had taken our order when we first got there and were waiting, as once we got seated upstairs it was about another hour until we got our pizza. Overall, good experience and I would definitely come again!
Our favorite pizza place in chicago. Skip the long lines of tourists at all the other downtown spots and bring your family and friends here. It's a much more local feel with great food.

Brenda was awesome. She really helped us out in a bind. Because we were traveling internationally and had card issues with fraud alerts, she was kind enough to make our order happen while we sorted out our credit card situation. Had she not done this in order to facilitate our order, we would have probably never tried (or gone back to) her establishment.

For the record- we were a late night order, so time was of the essence.

Much appreciate her faith in us, and let it be known that- given how great her service was, and delicious the pizza is- we shall now be regular customers, having recently moved here and this being our first pizza order in Chicago.

Thank you, Brenda!

This was the least flavorful "deep dish" pizza I've ever experienced. The deep dish was more "pan pizza" and less deep dish. The sauce was in dire need of salt, the crust was soggy and the meat lacked any flavor at all. Where was the cheese? Several people recommended this restaurant over my favorite Giodarnos and over Lou Malnatis, but I'm convinced they lacked tastebuds. The only positive was our waitress Tessa, who was polite and attentive. I was otherwise, beyond disappointed.

fast service
pizza is ok
a friend of mine recomend this place
i order mediam peperoni 1/2 whit mushrooms and jalapenos when the pizza arrive omg was a lot of jalapenos like i order extra
also order the apetizer was ok

This really needs no help with a rating. I will tho, since I see some disgruntled NY and other folks who live out of town have given lower ratings.
The crust is always just the right amount of crisp and done. It's a deep dish pizza done correctly, where others fail. The toppings are always tasty. I've never had it soggy, its always been slightly burnt, like their signature, and perfectly done thru the rest.
So Fort Worth, Miami, Anh (real trendy spelling) and dorky Jake from SF, just stay in your respective smellier cities.
Best deep dish in town baby!!!!

Great food, great service, reasonable prices, best pizza in chicago! 5 starts, id definitely recommend trying this place , if you dont live in town, trust make the trip west over here its awesome, great bar to watch sports games too!

I always tell people this place is a hybrid of Giordrano's and Lou's. It's got the pie-stuffed feeling of Giordano's and the delicious buttery crust of Lou's. I'm picky, but I call it the perfect pizza.

If you're having dinner prepare to wait an hour for a table and another hour for the pizza. Just remember it's worth be wait.

At the servers suggestion , we ordered a large Pequod salad and a large Caesar to have while our pizza cooked   $9.50 each--iceberg lettuce, one sliced mushroom 3 cherry tomatoes a few onion slices . Poor.

We ordered 2 large pan pizzas, different toppings . The first one came out for 1/2 the group. 20 minutes later we had to flag someone down to look for the second pizza. 1/2 the group had finished eating.
They came back a few minutes later with 2 mediums and no apologies.

Pizza crust was amazing!

Always have their amazing pizza when I can. Love the lunch deals and I love the burnt cheese crust. The wait is typically pretty long but it is definitely worth it for this pizza. I am the kind of person who does come here during the less crowded times. Make sure you go during lunch for the 4.95 lunch special. Also there is a bar next door where you can have a drink while you wait. The buzzer will work in there while you wait.

I do like sitting on the second floor better as it does feel cozier, especially for how long you have to wait, and they service I get up there is typically better. The past few times I have been here the servers have not been too warm and welcoming and it looked like they were just fed up by the huge crowds and lines. Us customers just can't help it when the cooks make this pizza so addictive so we keep coming.

This is definitely a local mostly location and the best place in my opinion for deep dish in Chicago. This is coming from someone who doesn't pizzadiscriminate.

Best to come in on a weekday if you're looking to dine in (carry outs good, but doesn't compare to pizza right out the oven) cause it's always super busy but this pizza really does live up to the hype.
One of the best Chicago deep dish pizza! Love their crust! They also have an awesome lunch special for $5.95

Came here on the suggestion of different locals. Left supremely disappointed. The pizza was not deep dish, which is what we expressed that we wanted when Pequads was suggested. What we got was a very thick pan pizza with little to no cheese, bland sauce, and unappealing toppings. It was really unfortunate, as we picked this place over Lou Malnati's. Won't make that mistake again.

I went to Chicago for vacation and knew I couldn't leave without trying Chicago's deep dish pizza. We ended up picking Pequod's.

We came on a Friday evening and had an approximately two hour wait. Luckily, there's a Barnes and Noble nearby to pass the time. After getting seated, we ordered a medium pizza, which was the perfect size for three, with fresh basil, sausages, and mushrooms. The basil seemed to be lacking in both quantity and flavor, but the other two toppings complemented the pizza really well! The crust of Pequod's pizza is also to die for and was yummy.

This place has great pizza but the service tonight ON MY BIRTHDAY was terrible! I ordered a pizza at 8:15pm. Now it's 10:17 I just cancelled the order because it never came. Some idiot lost my order. They took half off my bill and promised my order would be ready in 15min at 9:50pm. 25min later my food wasn't ready, so I cancelled my order. I hate incompetence. I will never eat here again. I'd rather spin month at a place that might not taste as good but have enough good sense, not to lose my order. What's worse is u can believe I drove damn near an hour to get it. Never again. And I'll be sure to tell/talk anybody I know out of coming here. Here's a tip: Get some better business Practices!!! Thanks!!!

For years, I've ben so confused as to why Pequod's isn't the place you hear about most for pizza. I tell anyone visiting that they need to go here. It's such a great spot and doesn't feel chainlike at all.

Pequod's is a rock solid pizza and I've been going there for 25 years. It's a bit of a wait most of the time so come early grab a beer and most importantly order in advance so you can sit down and eat your pizza right away instead of having to wait for your pizza order once you finally sit down. The pizza crust is crispy although I admit it could use a little salt. Thin crust is what my son likes. When you can hook a 13 year old on good pizza it creates an experience he'll have his entire life. Speaking of experience the place has a lot of character. Good place to take a date or a family!
Such awesome pizza! Crisp crust, great sauce, and tasty toppings. The only issue is the wait, as they don't take reservations and they're so popular. They should expand!

Delicious deep dish pizza!! We ordered and got it delivered and the delivery was pretty speedy for
Deep dish. Would definitely have it again.

On my flight over to Chicago I watched an episode of "Delicious Destinations" which was all about places to eat while in the City in which they recommended this place.  I was overly disappointed when coming here.  Service and everything was fine, but the sauce on the pizza was filled with entirely too many seasonings.  It reminded me of a marinara sauce made by someone who doesn't know what they are doing, I really didn't like it.

Also- they are known here for this "signature" burnt cheese crust.  I can't understand for the life of me what makes it that special.  It tastes exactly like you would imagine, like burnt cheese.  I wouldn't waste my time coming here if you are visiting- stick with Lou Malnatis.

Second stop on my Chicago pizza tour. And the BEST!

A lot smaller then Lou's and Gino's. Reminded me a of a dive restaurant, limited seating area.

Not located in the downtown area. Located away from all the tourist stuff.

Lunch special is best deep dish pizza deal you can find. Only Monday - Friday 11AM-3PM.

Chicago Lunch Special - $4.95 + $.80 + $.80 = $6.55 - 7 Pan Cheese Pizza with Pepperoni & Sausage -  Not tall as other deep dish pizza I had but the toppings were still loaded on. What sets Pequod's apart is that crispy cheese they get on the crust. The crust is already thick and buttery but adding the cheese to crisp up while cooking brings it to another level.

No wonder they are always voted top pizza in America!

pics.caption: Chicago Lunch Special - $4.95 + $.80 + $.80 = $6.55 - 7 Pan Cheese Pizza with Pepperoni & Sausage

review.des:
Everything was stellar except that their crust is waaaaaay too thick, even if their cheese, sauce and toppings are on the generous side, as well.

I am impressed that despite the thickness of the bread, it was not in any way soggy from the other ingredients piled on top of it. Meatball topping is great. I just cannot abide by their thick bread.

Before anyone gets outraged for the 1 star rating, this review is only for their veggie pizza.

I got a pan pizza while my friend got the thin crust one and both of them were so disappointing, the thin crust slightly less so. It looked like raw unseasoned veggies were just added on top of a cheese pizza. The pizza sauce tasted like canned tomato sauce. The only thing good about the pan pizza was the crust. Rightly done, I am sure this pizza could have been amazing.

It took us 30 mins to get a table and additional 30 minutes before the pizza was brought out. So not worth the time or money if you are a vegetarian.
This place is great! Serves is great the pizza is mouth watering. Highly recommend this place!

I had been meaning to come to Pequod's for the longest time and finally made it here on a Monday night.  Pro tip: Go on a weekday.  We were seated immediately.  

My fiancé and I split a deep dish pizza, and it was quite tasty.  Not mindblowingly great enough for me to make the trek back up to Pequod's soon (I live within walking distance of a Gino's, Giordano's, and Lou's), but I certainly enjoyed myself.  The service was kind, and restaurant's atmosphere was comfortable but nothing special.  I would return if in the area!

I had made up my mind after trying 3 other famous Chicago pizza places that I just didn't like deep dish pizza. Nothing was really that tasty. That's when a friendly local told me to give it one more try at Pequod's. I love to eat so I accepted the challenge.

We took the train out to the nearest stop, but the nearest stop was about a 30 minute walk to the restaurant. It was sort of a good thing because we worked up a big appetite by the time we arrived. The restaurant has a cool neighborhood-y dive vibe, which I liked. It felt more like a college bar than a pizzeria.
