I ordered a pizza for delivery and they told me an hour and 10 minutes. Which I was fine with. Almost 2 hours in when I still haven't received my pizza I called and shawna? picked up the phone. When I asked why it's taking this long, she said "that's how Pequod's is". What kind of answer is that? I then said well why don't you tell people 2 hours instead of lie and say only an hour? She said "that's how Pequod's is. I asked for a manager and she hung up the phone on me. Horrible customer service! I will not be ordering from this place ever again and I hope this review helps other people if they don't receive there food when they were told they were going to get it.

Major disappointment. It was the crust/base.  At this place deep dish means a whole lot of bread with a small amount of toppings.  We went to Giordano's and Lou Malnati's the two nights prior and based on the reviews thought we were saving the best for last.  Nope!  It was ok but certainly not in the same league as the others.  Way too much dough and average quality toppings. Waitress was ok, decor was like a dive bar (which I like when the food is outstanding), wouldn't recommend and wouldn't go back.
Pretty damn good deep dish! The tomato bisque soup was also yummy. The appetizer sampler wasn't that great, but we ordered it since we knew the wait would be long. If not for the app, 5 stars!

With chains like Giordano's and Lou Malnati's serving up deep dish in Chicago, Pequods is certainly a hidden gem. However, it is my FAVORITE deep dish pizza in Chicago and I never fail to mention it to those looking to try deep dish for the first time. I took my family here and they also agreed it was the best pizza they've ever had.
There's more of a sports bar vibe from Pequods than from the other chain restaurants, it's often dark, open late, and there can be tons of people depending of if there's a game or not.
What sets Pequods apart is their crust on the deep dish. It's perfectly cooked so that it's carmelized and crispy which makes the pizza that much better. You can't get crust like that elsewhere.
Keep in mind that deep dish pizza can take a while to cook so either be prepared to wait (it's worth it) or order some appetizers in the mean time. On weekdays, you can call in and order ahead of time so that the pizza will come out faster once you've arrived.
They also don't take reservations so on weekends and nights when there's a sporting event get there early or be prepared to put down your name and wait.

Lovveee their deep dish (pan pizza)! I would seriously rank this place as my second or first choice for deep dish in Chicago! I have a group of friends whom which we go to a different pizza joint every week. We have tried Giordanos, Ginos, Lous, Piece, Dantes, Boiler Room and this place is a great place for deep dish!

Service at the restaurant was great! Our waitress was very friendly and took good care of us... she joked around with us the entire time we were there. Another thing I really appreciated about this place was that we told a staff member who brought the pizza to the table that we were excited to try this pizza and wanted to compare to other we have tried. He instead of bashing or bad mouthing other pizza joints given he works there instead talked about other pizza joints he visits or which other pizza he would recommend we tried! I thought that was pretty awesome!

I will def be back in the near future to have more of that yumminess!!!

I've been hearing about Peqoud's for a while now and finally decided to give it a shot. I ordered a sausage and pepperoni pan pizza and a side of mozzarella sticks for delivery. I called at 11am, as soon as they opened, and was told it would take 1 hour 15 minutes. It ended up being 2 hours before the pizza arrived, which was extremely frustrating as the estimated time they gave me was totally off.

Already hangry by the time it finally arrived, I was praying it was worth the wait. The mozzarella sticks weren't cooked very well and were pretty bland. The pizza itself was very good and unlike some other pizza places, they didn't skimp on the toppings. There were plenty of huge pieces of sausage and pepperoni and I was sufficiently full after 2 pieces.

Overall the pizza was delicious, but not delicious enough to justify the wait. Maybe I'll try dining in sometime in the future, but I'm not in a rush anytime soon.

pics.caption: Mozzarella sticks. In my opinion, not worth it.
Sausage and pepperoni pan pizza. Super delicious and filling!

review.des: If you are into more bread, less cheese, then this is the place for you. The 5 Star point was the sauce. The one star point was the rude waitress, she corrected everything we said, seemed so bothered by our existence, very frustrating.

I start to say pizza at its best! Although service need some work. I ordered my food 45 minutes in advance. Got there and hostess was not pleasing me at all. I Asked for regular monthly table, and she lost it. Finally, gave in and embarrasses her self in front of other customer. When I sat down pizza took another 45 minutes. Hostess name : Stacy
I will come back for pizza and hope for better service.

I tried Lou's but I liked Pequads better the inside of the restaurant is darker and the pizza crust and bottom are burnt in those big black pans they use.
Great sauce it's near the Lincoln park area which is a pretty cool area of Chicago go there and be prepared to be full!

This place is SOOOO hyped up, so I figured I would order it one Sunday when bored. This is typical pizza nothing fancy or extra about it. Being in Chicago you have to stand out... very disappointed. Not in the place per say, but more in the people must have had some terrible pizza in there life to consider this "the best"
Best Chicago pizza hands down the crust is amazing. Extra red sauce is key.

Pequod's and a movie - could there BE a better date night? Nope!
Located right across the street from Regal Webster Place 11, Pequod's has THE best deep dish pizza. I'm not generally a deep dish fan but the caramelized crust can't be beat. Also, their deep dish tends to be on the saucy side which is key for me.

The place itself is authentic, narrow and too damn crowded. I prefer the second floor where there's slightly more elbow room. We always call in advance to make a reservation, thereby cutting the wait time in half.
Open opinion time, peqouds is my new favorite Chicago deep dish pizza place. This location is big and the servers are friendly though it seems a bit unorganized as we had a few people waiting on us.

I don't get it. I'm more of a thin crust pizza gal, but even so, there's just way too much crust and not enough sauce. Then if you order extra sauce / ranch dressing to make the pizza more palatable, they charge you extra. $2 for a ramekin of bottled ranch dressing? Come on. And it takes a good 45 minutes for the pizza to come.  Why there is constantly a line outside, I will never understand. I can check the box on this place and don't ever have to go back now.

It was deep dish pizza and it was good but it was not mind blowing. The style of the restaurant is more "Bar-like" not super family friendly. Overall, the pizza was good but I also would have been happy with Round Table.

The staff was wonderful and amicable, but the pizza was not as tasty and delectable as expected for a highly reviewed Chicago Deep Dish Pizza eatery.  I must say, I was highly disappointed as this restaurant has received high accolades for the taste of the pizza, and I didn't experience that wonderful taste as mentioned in the reviews.  The dough had no flavor, and it was just toppings on a pizza nothing fantastic.  Papa Johns and MOD pizza were better tasting.  The staff again was wonderful they just need to improve on the pizza.

Came here once as it came highly recommended.  I'd say it's my second favorite deep dish to Lou's.  Had to get extra sauce which I'd recommend to break the huge amount of cheese on the pie.  We waited probably an hour before we were able to get some bar seats which was fine.  I'd go back, but not worth waiting a long time.

This was my first time in Chicago and I couldn't have the complete tourist experience without a taste of deep dish pizza.  This place definitely delivered!  I'm a New York pizza kinda girl and a little skeptical about this infamous deep dish pizza but the caramelized crust is absolutely delicious and all the oooey goooey cheese is what dreams are made of.  You do have to wait a while for the pizza but I am telling you it is totally worth it.

Good pizza, but don't ever order this place for catering or delivery. 3 times I've called 48 hours before, and they ALWAYS lose the order.
They have no system in place to keep them straight. The answer I always get is "the register prints it up the day you call, but it was put in the wrong place in the kitchen". You may say, "Why not just call the same day?" To that I say, "Because they don't open until 10 and if I need a lunch catering order, they wouldn't have enough time to fulfill it." When I called today to check where our 11:45 order was (it was 11:50 when I called). After the person answering the phone couldn't find the order, then I was put on hold and a manager came to the phone, I was told "they were running late", when I asked how late, they said it would be here at 12:45! This is NOT A TYPO! They were going to be an entire hour late!! I asked if they WERE "running late" how come no one could find my order when I called?? I told them to NOT LIE about it and just admit that they lost/misplaced the order AGAIN!! They FINALLY arrived at 1:15! An hour and 1/2 hour later than I needed it for a meeting! I'd have stopped using them all together after the 2nd screw up, but occasionally someone from our office wants it instead of Malnati's. But after this time, I am done (at least they credited me for the entire order. Doesn't make it less embarrassing in front of a client when lunch is 90 minutes LATE! Get it together, guys!

After disappointing tries of the deep dish all around Chicago, Pequod's met the mark. Pequod's serves personal deep dish pizzas at a very reasonable price and minimal wait time. I would go back again, if I was in the neighbourhood!

Well, I found my favorite pizza in Chicago. This place is awesome. It is in a pretty low key spot on Clybourn just past Webster, slightly busy street, parking is not very easy on the street.

If you come past 6pm any night, expect a long wait, we happened to get here right before the evening rush and did not have to wait, and if you're coming in on a weekend, there is usually a very long line outside, but it's worth the wait!

We sat upstairs, it's a very cool/ fun vibe all over. There are a few TV's around, but nothing too overwhelming and everyone that works here is really nice.

We started with a house salad, big enough to share, and then we went to the pizza... We ordered the Medium pan pizza, we each only ate one slice it was so delicious and filling. You choose your own toppings, they don't have any set pizzas on the menu, and the pizza was divine. The crust is sweet, buttery and savory in one heavenly bite, along with the sauce and toppings, it's just amazing.

I will for sure be back! :)
As always, Pequods is amazing pizza.  You will have a wait but it's phenomenal pizza and great calamari.
Stop looking for a better Pizza any way I see it they are tops in Chicago. But why the name of Moby Dicks boat? Interesting fact! Great place to go!

My friends and I went here for a late lunch and it was my only experience of deep dish pizza while in Chicago. The place was packed, even at 3 PM on a Saturday afternoon but we were seated promptly. The service was sufficient, nothing to write home about. The pizzas were tasty, very generous on the toppings and the marinary sauce was yummy! We had the house made meatballs (10/10 would recommend) and ham and pineapple and both were pretty tasty. The wait time is about 40 minutes so make sure you put your order earlier rather than later.

The BEST deep dish pizza in all of Chicago!!!  Don't even waste your time going to the other places.

The pizza was the perfect combination of fluffy crunchy cheesy and yummy!!

YES!

believe all the buzz and fuzz you read online! this place is great.  The service is great, the food comes out fast even though they are BUSY...

Friendly wait staff and the pizza! oh the pizza! it's so good!

Only negative part is sometimes the wait, but it's totally worth it!
It is indeed American style but not as good as the one I tried in Central Chicago. The outlook is ugly even though the price is really fair.
Amazing amazing pizza!!!!  Best deep dish ever!!!  Loved it!!!!  Will be back for sure !!!

Pequod's stole a pizza my heart. This is the best 'za in town! My wife and I dined in last weekend and are still talking about that caramelized crust! I don't think we'll be eating Giordano's anytime soon. The service was great too. Erin and Alan took good care of us...my mouth was watering when that first slice got cut and placed gently on my dinner plate. Goodness, I've gotta get back to this joint ASAP. God Bless Pequod's!

PS - If for some strange reason you don't like the pizza from this spot, you're a weirdough!
My husband a huge fan, Pizza crust made by angels. Not sure how they get it to crispy - yet thick; sauce and toppings were excellent. Fast service- friendly - parking ok

The place is awesome the personal deep could feed a army I ate 1/3 of the pizza and was stuffed.

I have also tried the Italian beef there one of the best.

The pizza at Pequods was excellent. I enjoyed it so much. The Deep Dish I had was half pepperoni and sausgage and half pepperoni, sausage, olives and peppers! I reallly enjoyed it (Extra L for emphasis). The Deep Dish was more of a Pan Pizza which had a thick crust. For my first time having true Chicago Deep Dish pizza it was pretty good. Next time Im in Chicago Id like to have the Deep Dish slice that has the toppings in the center and bottom as opposed to the top. Back to Pequods though. The pizza was crunchy and the cheese was perfectly burned along the edges. I thought that it was great. The service was pretty good. The pizza did take a while to arrive, but Im starting to learn that pizza making is a bit of a slow art form.

So overall this was great pizza. The toppings were tasty and the pepperoni was really good. Can't wait to get back to the Windy City to have some more. 5 Stars

I went to this place with high expectations........I will say that i think it was below my expectations. We waited about 1.5 hours to be seated. The best part was that there is a bar "The Drinkingbird" next door and we were able to drink and wait there so that worked out. I'm pretty easy going so the wait didnt bother me....tequila makes everything better anyway. I think i did myself a disservice by ordering the deep dish in a "personal" size.  We ordered two personal sized deep dish pizzas so that we could try two different types. I think you definitely gotta go for a bigger pizza to get the full effect. We also ordered the sampler appetizer and i really enjoyed that. I'm definitely going to give this place another shot next time I visit chicago to confirm my feelings! lol Thanks guys!
Great delivery service and good prices. The deep dish was a bit too "bready" but overall, it was good.
Came here late on a weekday evening. Their pan pizza is so good!! Wasn't busy at all, had a good time.

I last had Pequods 8 years ago and it was outstanding ..so I was so looking forward to picking up my pizza. I ordered at 4:30 told it would be ready in an hour. Arrive at 5:30 give my name and pay for the pizza ( large deep dish pepperoni and sausage ).  5:45 I ask after 3 people get their carry out pizza who arrived after me "when can I expect my pizza ". Young lady states I don't know ". I wait another 10 minutes watch 2 more people receive their pizzas and ask the young lady Is there a problem.  She asks my name  and she looks and says it just came up but she needs to take a few more tickets because they're backed up.. A manager appears and has a brief conversation and takes the tickets ..I'm waiting it's now 6:15.  He comes out with three pizzas mine is on top!  I take the pizza and despite the wait anxious to get home and taste it!  I've had deep dish pizza and this pizza was way too much like pizza bread!   Too puffy and doughy!  The flavor is good but not what I remembered taste wise. I was and am very disappointed!!!  
Sorry people but I don't agree that this is a pizza worth the wait or price.

Give yourself time if you are going to dine in. I've been here at least 5x and every time the wait for a table was at minimum 45 minutes and no reservations.The pizza takes forever to come out...food is an art I get it, just a warning. My suggestion would be to call 30-45 minutes before you intend on coming to see what they wait time is like. Their pizza isn't bad, I'm just a die hard Lou's fan. The crust on Peaquod's pizza is fluffier and softer than Lou's buttercrust. Have it and you be the judge Lous or Peaquods?! Service was nothing special.

Went here expecting SO much more than I actually got. Pizza was really not that good. I would honestly say that Giordano's, Gino's East, even Lou Malnati's are all a million times better than the crust/sauce/cheese here. The staff was very inattentive and careless. It took her about 13-14 minutes to bring our drinks, after we waited about 30 to be seated and 10 to be greeted by a server. We ordered our pizza which took about 40 minutes to make (super reasonable for a deep dish). After trying to get her attention for about 15 minutes after being completely done with eating our food (which took about 25 minutes because we were STARVING), we told her (our server) that we were in a rush so head out and if she could bring our check. She was rushed and said okay and brought us our checks. We put in our card and she took the payment and we did not see her for the next 40 minutes, after requesting her to please hurry up because we were running late at this point. I have never been this disappointed with a place's food AND service (well, lack of service, actually).

Save your taste buds, go somewhere else. Actually, go anywhere else. This place sucks.

If you plan on coming here on the weekend, make sure you call hours ahead of time to get priority seating once you get there. The place is super crowded on weekends, with hour waits for pizza. The service was okay (could have been better).

After waiting an hour for pizza, I thought it would be on the same level of delicious as Lou Malnati's. The pizza was burned, and it tasted like Tombstone frozen pizza. The bread was too dry. Not my kind of pizza.
Hands down the best Chicago pizza experience.  Get there early and grab a drink next door.

I like Peqouds deep dish. Yum. So filling. So satisfying. Reasonable.

Decent beer and drink list/menu.

Not fancy nor pretentious. Causal.

If you love pizza the way I love pizza then this is the spot to go! Pequods is Pizza Heaven. I have tried multiple pizza spots and this one is my number one in Chicago. I can start from the unique buttery and tasty deep dish burnt crust to the perfect amount of sauce and cheese with the toppings! Totally worth the cheat meal and food comma. It is usually packed so prepare to wait for at least 30 minutes to be seated on weekends. Once you're seated the service is legit. Pequods is a must go!

Deep dish pizza at its finest. Truly, it doesn't get any better than this. Beautiful, carmelized crust that is to die for. It's heavy and you'll be full afterwards, but your tummy will be happy.

I'm fairly picky when it comes to deep dish, this place hits the mark.

I ate the crust and I don't usually eat crusts. I ordered onion, garlic, green bell pepper, and spinach. There were a lot of toppings, so many toppings they were coming off the pizza and I even got a bonus green olive and some red peppers. I was full after 1-1/2 slices. The only downside was over an hour for delivery, but luckily I wasn't hungry when I ordered.

So we waited 2+ hours for our pizza to be delivered. When we called 1h30 in, the lady on the phone told us it should have been delivered 10 min ago, and to call her back 15 mins later in case it still didn't show. When we called back 15 min later, she said to be patient and it would be 20 more minutes but she "didn't have a gps on the car". She did not call the driver. Thanks Pequod's for the service, you could use staff training.
Best pizza in Chicago. Get a large thick pizza with car Malone's cheese on the sides and fries! Best and favorite pizza and I am from Chicago. Staff is always busy but nice. Love it
Decent pizza but nothing special or outstanding . We always order the thin crust and it's pretty standard and good .

Overall our favorite deep dish pizza in the City. But frankly, have to recognize their capacity to disappoint. Last time, the sauce was lacking flavor and the salad was not fresh (it was replaced). In recent past, pizza not hot all the way through. And once we had a booth with a side wall crawling with bugs (like gnats). We keep going back because when it's good, it is very good. Somebody in charge should step up to address the inconsistencies though because patience does not always last.

This review is long overdue. The only bad part about Pequods is delivery...it really is a dine in meal worth every minute of wait time. This, in my humble opinion is the best of the best when it comes to Pizza in this beautiful place we call planet Earth.
If you're a Chicagoan, you have to get here often, if you're a tourist it is a MUST STOP AND EAT.

Let me start by saying I am NOT a deep dish fan. It is too much for me, but naturally you have to get one because you are in Chicago. Pequod's is what the locals recommended so we came here to see what it was all about. The pizza's crust isn't that dense thick crust that we all think when we think Deep Dish. This crust was thin and crunchy- very much like a cheese crisp. This is the best deep dish I have ever tasted- the cheese to sauce ratio was all on point. I wish I could say this place has made me a deep dish convert- but that would be a lie. But if you like deep dish then this place will most definitely be your go to spot.
Absolutely love their deep pan pizza! I think tourists should check this place out! Great atmosphere, great service and amazing mouth watering food!

Amazing pizza! I went there around 4:30 on a Sunday - no line and just beat the football crowd. The pizza took about 40 minutes to make and the pizza is so cheesy! I love the causal dining environment and very laid back. I will definitely be back next time when I am in town

I had never heard of this pizzeria before my brother mentioned it to me. We got our pizza delivered in a timely manner, unlike most places. Pizza itself definitely surprised me because it held its own against my all time favorite-Lou's. I dare say I think this was better than any other deep dish pizza I've had to this day... Go try it if you love some classic deep dish style pizza!

Delicious pizza, terrible wait.

So the pizza is 4-stars, but the service is 2-stars. I put in a request online for priority seating about 4 days early and never got any sort of email confirmation so I called the day of to confirm. The girl who answered wasn't all that friendly and begrudgingly added me to the list. It was packed when we walked in and I was told about an hour wait. Well...we waited 2 hours. Now I understand the priority seating is not a reservation, but it's supposed to cut the wait time in half. You can't tell me a normal wait time was 4 hours! It's an understatement to say the host seemed overwhelmed, so I'm not sure the priority seating list was really happening.

Once we were seated the service continued to be slow, and the waitress didn't seem to move all that quickly. At about 9:30 the pizza finally arrived and everything was right in the world again. I was so excited about the caramelized cheese on the crust and I'm happy to report it did not disappoint! YUM!

Despite the delicious crust, I'll be sticking to my old buddy Lou Malnati in the future - shorter waits and they let you put in your pizza order before you get a table. I will only be revisiting Pequod's for take out.

This is easily the best pizza I have had in years.  My order had a couple of custom features (light cheese/extra sauce) to it and they got both of them right.  This is totally uncommon as most places strive only to get the ingredients right.  I had carryout but the dining atmosphere looked great too.  Highly recommend.

Had the deep dish pizza but not impressed as others have reviewed. I think they had the pizza undercooked as this place was fairly busy and our pizza came out super fast.  Wish the deep dish was cooked a bit more as it would have been better.  While we had to wait for our table we had few beers right next door. Will give it another shot when they are not that busy.

It was very good, wait for the pizza was longer than expected!
Bad news, their is nothing like a NY Style pizza from back home in NYC!
Great deep dish pizza. Sauce and the crust are both excellent. Very generous with toppings. Fun atmosphere with friendly staff.

Was able to try this and Lou Malnati's while in Chicago and this place is #1 for deep dish in my book. The service was great and the atmosphere was fun. The crust is the specialty here, they pile layers and layers of cheese on the side of the pan, making a cheesy, burnt crust that made it so crunchy and flavorful. And the fact that we were able to choose the toppings was what got me super excited.

After a night of drinking, nothing was more satisfying than this, and of course, we had to order more drinks.. We literally piled it high with mounds of toppings! We got mushrooms, jalapenos, fresh garlic, sausage, Italian beef, and hot giardiniera. The giardiniera and Italian beef is definitely a must-get. Can't wait to come back!
I love this place !! The pizza and wings are worth the money and annoying parking search.

Okay, so this is my favorite pizza of all time. Sadly, I haven't gotten it as many times as I would like.

The personal pizza I recently ordered really lacked flavor compared to the full size deep dish I normally get to share.

The biggest issue I've had here is when I waited an hour for a large pizza for pick up, went to pick it up to find out they made the wrong size. The size they made would not have been enough food for my group, so they offered the pizza they made at a discount, or wait another 40 minutes for the pizza I ordered. I had no choice but to wait and still had to pay full price for the pizza. No discount, no apology, nothing. Really frustrating.

Such a shame as I've always been such an advocate for this place and have stayed away lately.  Might have to venture out to the Morton grove location to get my fix!

Delicious pizza! The deep dish personal size is very filing.

It took about 40 minutes to get our pizza so plan to stay a while and get an appetizer if you're hungry already. We got the cheesy garlic bread and it came out quickly and was very tasty.

pics.caption: Deep dish personal, with onions and peppers

review.des:
This was the second place we tried on our quest to taste "famous" Chicago pizza. So far we're not understanding how these places have earned their reputations.

We ordered our pizza to be delivered and it came in an hour. That was perfectly fine with us (it was a Saturday night and was actually delivered on the lower end of the time frame I was given). Pizza arrived hot and fresh.

Just to clarify, Pequad's does not make a deep dish pizza. I see a lot of reviews calling their pizza deep dish and it's not, it's a pan pizza, which means it's a very thick crust. We knew this before we ordered and we are fans of pan pizzas, so this wasn't a surprise for us. We ordered a personal sized pepperoni, and a large pineapple.

Overall, the pizza was edible. Sauce was mild in flavor (but at least it had some flavor compared to the other place we tried), there wasn't a ton of cheese (this could be good, or bad depending on your preference), and the crust had no flavor and was way too dry. I don't think I've ever had pizza crust fall apart due to being too dry. That was the biggest downfall of this pizza...dry crust that isn't very flavorful equals a lackluster pizza. The cheese caramelization on the edge of the crust was right on the cusp of being overdone. If it had been cooked any longer that cheese would have been burnt to an inedible state. Thank goodness it wasn't cooked to that point, but it was really close. Maybe if it was cooked a couple minutes less the crust wouldn't have been so dry and the caramelized cheese along the edges would have been in a more enjoyable state

I don't eat dairy or eggs and I decided to in order to find out what makes Chicago's pizza great. So far that decision hasn't been worthwhile. You're letting me down Chicago!

Went on a busy Friday night, and when we checked in, there was an hour wait but two seats happened to open up at the bar within about 10 minutes, so we snagged those (bar is first come, first served). We ordered jalapeño poppers and a small sausage and onion deep dish pizza. The bartender got our drinks out quickly and the poppers were out within 10 minutes. They are the cheesy kind, not the cream cheese kind like I am used to, but they were still delicious and not too greasy. The pizza took longer (about 40 minutes) but we were expecting that as there is a big sign on the hostess stand setting that expectation. It was WORTH THE WAIT. The pizza was delicious and the crust was amazing.
Pizza takes fucking forever, but my god it is delicious.

Not worth the wait at all.  We arrived at 7:30, were seated at 8:45, and weren't served until 10:40. I was fully prepared to wait but quite frankly almost two hours for food is ridiculous. Manager obviously didn't care when we complained and I'm 99% confident that they gave our order to the table across from us and that's why it took so long to be served. And the pizza was lackluster even though I was ravenous by the time it arrived. Overhyped and underwhelming.

Beddia in Philly has one man making pies and they are always slammed b/c of their Bon Apetit review and yet they manage to keep their shit together and consistently deliver. No excuse. Figure it out.

My girlfriend and I had a bad experience here a few months ago, and I posted about it on Yelp. Within minutes, the manager emailed me to apologize for what happened and told us to come back whenever we wanted and that he would buy us dinner.

We did that tonight - and everything was excellent (and free). My girlfriend and I split the Pequod's salad and kept it simple with the pizza (large deep dish wish pepperoni and sausage). We have plenty of leftovers for tomorrow, and the staff and managers couldn't have been nicer to us.

I've been to this location probably a half dozen times and will continue to go in the future. Thanks, Pequod's, for your excellent customer service! (And pizza!)

I don't understand the fascination with this place. Sure the deep dish is different and good but with so many pizza places in the city and being a thin crust fan I don't think I'll eat their pizza again.

45 minute wait for the table then 1 hour and 15 minute wait for the pizza  but it was well worth it!
Cooked to perfection. The burnt edges has amazing flavor. The sausage and pepperoni are fresh. Again definitely worth the wait time.

Heaven in the form of pizza. Forget the places you've heard about before and go here if you want good, Chicago pizza. The crust is perfect, the cheese ring around the edge is perfect, all around perfect pizza. Anyone who tells you this isn't Chicago pizza is wrong and you don't need that negativity in your life.

3 hour wait...3 hours!

I thought to myself, there is no way any pizza is worth waiting this long for!

We were a group of 7 and killed time at a nearby bar to snack on tacos. When it was our time we headed to the restaurant and took our seats upstairs in a booth under a large tv. The waitress took our orders and we were eating cheesy, bready appetizers within 15 minutes. I tried not to gorge so I could save my real appetite for this infamous pizza. I managed to eat half a appetizer and finally 45 minutes later our pepperoni and sausage pizza arrived. It was freakin amazing. I cherished every bite and wished my stomach was bigger to hold more of this saintly pizza. Others at the table ordered double sausage which was comical because when it arrived we could barely see the crust...there was soooo much sausage! Everyone who ate it said it was too much so don't bother getting a double order, they hook it up plenty without needing that.

I left smiling and think this is the best pizza I've ever had in Chicago. It's also very reasonably priced compared to other places. 3 hours is steep though so I'd attempt to go at a down time or order to go.

Pequod's Pizzeria, tomato sauce masters! I'm speaking specifically to all my heartburn people out there, this sauce will not keep you up at 3am in the morning, but enough about all that.

I came to Pequod's with my girlfriend, Gaby, wanting to try out this heavily hyped pie. The joint was juking, which was to be expected on a Friday night, but it only took us 40 minutes to get seated which was not bad due to the reputation of the joint and the incredible crowd waiting outside (pro tip: you can get ahead of the wait line if you call in for a table the day before).

To pass the time we went three doors over to the Drinkingbird and had a couple of Schiltz and PBR's for 3 dollars a pop while we waited. Once our buzzer thing vibrated we rushed over. Walking to our table all I was getting was college/frat vibes (esp. on the second floor) from the decor to the people. I went to UOI, so I'm a natural in this habitat (just wanted to fully disclose for all the anti-bros out there). Once seated we ordered immediately since we already knew what we came for and did not want to drag out the hold time of the pizza. We ordered buffalo wings and a medium pizza (sausage & pepperoni - 1/2 jalapenos).

The wings came out immediately and they were really good, the only problem for me was the price of the wings in comparison to the size of the wings. I literally, in one bite, can clean those wings. I drank one beer and a 1/4 of my second beer before the pizza came out which is okay (I like my pizza out before I finish my first beer (I sip lightly everyone, at restaurants only of course lol)).

Once the pie arrived, we dug in. The ingredients are to die for, plain and simple. It was GREAT! I can really see what all the hype is about and the fun atmosphere complemented the entire experience. Trust me - if you haven't tried this place, don't let the hold time faze you, you will be rewarded in the end.  

*****I will say this though, I AM NOT A FAN OF THE "CARAMELIZED" CRUST at the end. Idk if this is an accrued taste like wine or something BUT TO ME IT TASTE BURNT. The cheese and crust underneath the burnt ends tasted great nonetheless.

The restaurant as a whole is 4/5 for me - the wings 3/5 (this rating is leaning on the weight of the price) but the stuffed pie was 4.5/5. I will def. recommend this pie to friends and family.

Cheers everyone!

Favorite deep dish/authentic "Chicago-style" pizza. If you're from out of town and debating on which to try go to Pequod's! There will probably be a wait, but grab a drink and just relax - you're about to have the best pizza ever. The burnt cheese crust is simply to die for.

Pequods is a good as pizza gets. Plus this location is open late, late, late...perfect to hit after the bars in Lincoln Park.

The deep dish is excellent. Great Chicago-style done right. Sauce is rich, tomato-y and tasty.

The thin crust is also the bomb. Love the pepperoni.

Expect to have to wait for a table - especially late at night when everybody else has closed their kitchen. But, trust me, it will be worth the wait.

This is the BEST place for deep dish pizza!

My favorite part about the pizza here is how the edges of the crust are slightly burned so it's really crisp. I've tried 3 different deep dish pizza places in one day to compare them all (Pequod's, Giordano's, Lou Malnati's) and Pequod's is the best in my opinion! I can't comment on the service here; I always order for pick-up because I'm too impatient to wait, unless I am catching up with some friends and passing time anyway. Keep in mind that you will always have to wait for deep dish pizza if you expect a quality, fresh pizza no matter where you go.

This is quite arguably one of my top 2 BEST pizza places I've ever had in my life and I LOVE New York pizza.

I'm not a thin vs thick crust guy; I just love good pizza.

I've had the chain pizza places in Chicago and although Peq's isn't as deep, that's the beauty of it! You don't get too much bread, or cheese, or with little pepperoni... Peq's is just the perfect balance between bread, cheese, reeeeally love sauce, & pepperoni. & this is why I love this pizza! Plus, you don't get full off 1 slice, I had 3 bc I love to eat and didn't want to eat more because I didn't want to be that hog. Could've easily had 4 comfortably.

I'm from Cali and Cali has no good pizza. So when I travel, I try the landmark foods and this is by far the best pizza I've had in Chicago, hands down - in my top 2 pizzas EVER.

pics.caption: Pepperoni.. Beautiful & better than any other pizza in Chicago. Cheese is perfectly melted & reeeeally good sauce. Get it to go!

review.des: Deep dish done right. We had our medium pie delivered. While the delivery time was a little longer than what we would've like, the wait was well worth it. In a town with a pizza place on every corner, Pequad's stands apart. Try it, you won't regret it.

pics.caption: Medium pie w/ meatball, sausage, pepperoni, onions, peppers, and pepperoncini.

review.des: Best deep dish!! Wish there was a location Southern California!! The sauce was so flavorful and the mozzarella was top quality.
The food was great I ordered a veggie/ jalapeño deep dish with extra cheese and it exceeded my expectations. I would definitely come back!
Best deep dish in the city. Worth the wait!! The meatball sub is the best I've ever had!
The wait was reasonable for lunch (10-15minutes), the food was amazing!! It was about 2.5 $s but worth going there cause there's enough food for left overs

THE BEST DEEP DISH.

Don't let other's persuade you. If you are looking for deep dish, come here. Leave the others behind. All Chicago pizza places have a wait, but this one is worth it.

What makes them different from the rest is their amazing crust. Caramelized cheese crust. SO GOOD.

Just headed over, do it, right now!

If I had to eat just one thing for the rest of my life, this place would probably be the one - love love love this pizza joint to death!  It is JAF x 100 - hot peppers and basil all day man on my deep dish.  I love my friend Aamer for introducing this to me, so happy that he is the white guy in a brown guys body for letting me know about this gem of a place.  And whoever says this place is OK or it's not as good as lous or giordanos can really go back to their moms basement and eat tombstone pizza.
So good. Better then NYC pizza. Worth the wait and the prices. environment is amazing too.

I've been wanting to come here for a while now. Their's alot of hype about Chicago deep dish pizza. Everyone one I asked recommended this spot, so I had to give it a try.  I knew they would be a long wait but so did everywhere else. I started out with garlic bread to eaze the hunger a bit. When it arrived I was disappointed in the quality of the bread. Tasted like it came from the grocery store so I didn't finish. Then I ordered a salad and it was pretty basic as well, nothing special. They told me to wait for the pizza was 1 hour long, which was fine considering how many people were there. So I actually went next door and got some sushi and brought it back to the pizza place. They were totally cool with it. 20 mins later my DEEP DISH PIZZA showed up and it was HUGE! (I ordered a small btw) having waited this long I was pretty excited to dig in..........................Dam that pizza was worth the wait, and will totally go back. So 5 stars for there pizza but the rest of the food is decent. Which is expected since they specialize in deep dish. Non the less I had a good time and the hostess was nice. Thank you

Really bad service, long wait and waitress didn't understand the basics of food service.  Our app and salad were average at best, pizza was ok but disappointing based on our expectations.  Way too little cheese and Lou's crust is way better.

Chicago, I love you for many reasons, but your deep dish is high on the list.  Since moving away, every time I've been back, I've gone to Pequod's.  If you're going for dinner, be prepared for a long wait.  Most really great places in Chicago have long waits, so this is to be expected.  Since there isn't a lot of space to actually wait, you can always grab a drink at the bar that is two doors down, and they'll give you a call to let you know your table is ready.

I always start off my pizza meals with a salad to get some healthy veggies in.  But when at Pequod's I douse my salad in their ranch dressing because it has a little extra something in it that makes it awesome.  I think it may be extra garlicky or something, and it is great!  Their house salad also comes with cheese on top that shaped like a fish, which is always endearing.  All deep dish places have something they do a little differently.  Here at Pequod's they're known for their caramelized crust, which really sets them apart from the rest of the crowd.  You can't go wrong with any pizza you would choose.  It is some seriously tasty pizza!

My last visit in was over the holiday season during lunch time, and there was a bit of wait.  They have a nice little lunch combo for $4.95 that comes with a 7-inch cheese personal pizza and a fountain drink.  Regular toppings are $.80 extra, and you can also add a small lunch salad for a couple extra bucks.  We went this route, and I enjoyed the pizza, but I am firm believer that the personal pizzas at deep dish places are never as good as the full sized pizzas.  Please tell me I'm not alone in thinking this.  I swear it's the cooking time or something.

If you haven't tried Pequod's yet, you're missing out!
This is my LEAST favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago. The burnt Carmel crust was disgusting. Def won't be returning.

Definitely a pizza  joint you want to try if you have a big appetite. I was full after 2 slices. The place does get busy. We had to wait 1 1/2 hours before being seating and another 45 minutes for the pizza to bake. We ordered the garlic bread for appetizers and a small pepperoni, sausage, and onion for my wife and I. It was enough to get us full and crust is decent. Wasn't a big fan. We brought our 8 month old son and the restaurant was accommodating. Overall, wasn't worth the wait.

I've tried this restaurant once due to a friend's glowing recommendation, and was severely disappointed. We ordered delivery, so in fairness I haven't tried in person, but to say the order was botched would be an understatement.

My fiancé and I ordered two pizzas and a salad.

She is a vegetarian, so naturally we ordered a vegetarian friendly pizza.  Her pizza came overly dry, with very little sauce, and cold veggies.

My pizza came with burnt crust, and very poorly distributed sauce and ingredients.

The salad never came. The driver didn't alert me to it, and when I asked where it was he blamed the kitchen and said he only takes what they give him and doesn't have time to confirm the order. He offered me the cash equivalent to the salad since I paid with a card, and that he couldn't run the salad back to me since he was too busy.

Is this what you call customer service?

I called and asked for the manager. She replied with "what would you like us to do, we're busy".  What I would like is for you to take a basic level class in customer service and give a customer what they pay for.  She was useless and unapologetic.

Do not recommend. Won't be trying them again.

5 stars for dining in, 3.5 stars for takeout or delivery. Their pizza is about the best you can get when you eat it fresh at the restaurant - although waiting for a table can sometimes be a pain during prime times. But it is worth it if you have the time. The pizza loses something when you take it to go or have it delivered but it's still very good. There's not much bad to say about Pequod's.
Waited an hour and a half for deep dish.  It was good, but not the best pizza I've had in Chicago.  I'm gonna have to say, not worth the wait.

WOW WTH!!!! Never thought I'd be writing this review...... I've been going to both Pequod's locations for 20 plus years never had anything but great food and a nice wait staff. All changed tonight!!! Our deep dish pie was so dry I couldn't get through once slice, it was TERRIBLE, zero flavor, and get this with my two friends still eating, and a fresh round of beers our waitress asked if she could box our pizza to go and get our check, (thinking to myself WTF?) I replied really do you want us to leave?????
Best pies in the city. Always busy. So be prepared to wait, but definitely worth it. I would recommend them over any other spot even though there are plenty of great pizza spurs in Chi.
I'm not even two blocks outside of the delivery zone and the woman taking orders Friday night wouldn't even entertain the idea of delivery.

Best pizza in town but be prepared to wait for both delivery and at restaurant eating.   There must be a better delivery system to get you the food faster.   Regardless, it's worth the wait.    Best sausage in town

I love Chicago style pan pizza, and this is arguably the best pan pizza in the city (and outside because the morton grove location is great too). It's at least a must try for anyone, and you're crazy if you're not a fan of the crust

Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down. Not as nice of an atmosphere as some other deep dish chains but this pizza is the best. Ask for water if you want some otherwise they won't bring you any. Usually extremely long wait times.

I came alone and was seated promptly at a high two-top table. I'm glad they have a lot of small booths and tables. the iced tea tasted really sweet and definitely not freshly brewed. On the contrary, they do have a rotating Three Floyd's beer on tap, so props for that.

To start, I ordered a half Pequod's salad. I enjoyed it as it had a lot of different ingredients like pepperoni, mushrooms, cheese, and onions. The Italian dressing came in a plastic container, like I was taking it to go. The dressing was good, but not thrilling.

At 5:30 on a Friday night, it was already 50 minutes for a personal pizza. I ordered a pizza with sausage and mushrooms and added spinach to half. When it arrived it wasn't cut, so there was no picking this pizza up! The caramelized crust was very good, maybe not as good as Burt's crust was. The sausage was phenomenal, great seasoning, nice sized pieces. The spinach was whole leaves, not a chopped up mix like at Gino's East or Lou Malnati's. I coulde taste it, but was glad it didn't overwhelm the rest of the pizza. Also, the pizza tasted really saucy. I like a lot of sauce, but it was to the point where I could barely taste the cheese.

The service was...interesting. I had one server through the time that I placed my order. Then, I never saw her again. Another server took care of me the rest of the way. I had to ask if she was my server now and she said yes. I just expected to get some kind of explanation as to why there was a switch. Also, there isn't much space to walk, especially downstairs. I feel for the servers as they have to navigate through some really tight spaces.

It was a good experience and I'd enjoy having the pizza again.
This is a must try for fans of pan pizza. It is almost always where I take friends when they come to the city. I have never been disappointed!

Pequod's, you truly live up to all the hype everyone is talking about. Pequot's has the best deep dish pizza you will ever taste. Forget Lou Malnati's, Gino's, and Giordano's. They don't even come close to Pequod's.

Come early or call-in before you arrive to get on the list. My husband and I came on a Saturday night and were predicted a 2-hour wait. No worries though, we walked to the Drinkbird, just 2 stores down from Pequod's, for a drink while waiting. And shortly after finishing our first drink, we were notified that our table was ready. We waited for ~ 45 minutes before our table was ready. Just in case you were wondering, Barnes and Nobles is out of range for the sensor to work. Trust me, we asked them too.

What makes Pequod's so unique is their crust. That caramelized crust is so delicious that there are no words that can properly describe how amazing it tastes. You just have to come and try it yourself. I promise you you won't regret it, and it's worth the wait. You have to pay extra for each topping, but don't worry, they are very generous with their toppings.

NOTE: It takes ~45 minutes for your pizza to cook after you order, so you should order an appetizer. Their garlic bread is a great start for an appetizer when you're about to get hangry.

If you're Blackhawks fan, you'll love this place even more. :)

I've been to Pequad's a few times, so let me start by saying that the pizza is great. With that said, however, we had such an awful experience with their customer service that they deserve no more than 3 stars. I've been eating deep dish pizza my whole life, so I understand that it takes a long time to make; however, at Pequad's apparently it's supposed to take an hour and a half. That's what a manager tried to convince us of when, on a not so busy afternoon, the table next to us was seated, ordered, ate, and left all in the time that we waited for our pizza to come out. It was pretty frustrating at the time, but in retrospect kind of funny.

I'll most likely go back, because that crust... sooo good, BUT it's going to take a while for me to get over this.

So I ordered a full order of pasta with a side salad specifically asked for marinara sauce on top of the pasta with the melted cheese I hope I get the post a picture because they are as dry as can be no Parmesan cheese at all maybe I'm supposed to request that but actually it should automatically come with it so that will go in the garbage because I work 12-hour shifts and there's no way I'm going to wait 12 hours to eat and hopefully the salad will fill me up I will never order from them again!!!!!
NEVER AGAIN!!!!

pics.caption: Posted a picture of my dried pasta that I have pacifically requested extra sauce

review.des: This is the best pizza in chicago hands down. the toppings are fresh and the crust and caramelized cheese give the pizza a unique taste unlike any in the city. 5 stars and first recommendation to any of my out of town friends who want to know what chicago deep dish really is

I give them 5 stars for pizza but subtract 1 star for not being eco friendly. I ordered delivery and mentioned I'd be eating at home so asked for no plastic silverware, and received a plastic bag of plastic silverware for and paper plates for 6 people. It's just for me and my husband.  Why are restaurants so wasteful??

I have no idea why nobody opens a place like this anywhere in NYC or Charleston Sc.  I cant find any deep dish pizza anywhere on the east coast for that matter.  I dream about this pizza, it is so satisfying and hearty it really cant be described except overwhelmingly delicious!  

And for all of the yelpers who look at the top of the pizza and say; "why is there so little cheese?"  IT IS UNDERNEATH, they don't pile all of the cheese on top of the sauce, that's a defining characteristic of this type of pizza!!  Come on people get with the program, this ain't NY style.

We had a going away party on a Saturday. Thankfully, they allow you to put in a table request the day before via their site, which was great for our party of 10. (This is not a reservation. Just gives you priority seating.) You still have to come in a little earlier to wait, they will give you a pager which works near the bar at the Drinking Bird.

We ordered 3 large pizzas for 10 people and still had a few slices leftover. Pizza wise, it was okay...I wasn't drawn to it. there wasn't any flavor that stood out. it was just very thick pan pizza (not a layered pizza). I still like Lou Malnati's style pizza more and may prefer Giordano's over this.  

Service was fine and they also allowed us to split the check with many credit cards.

This is my favorite pizzeria , bar none ,and always gets top rankings for their pizza from the many, many restaurant reviews locally and nationally. We've been going there once a week for going for years due to the high quality pizza and great service staff. My only negative would be the whale symbol they use, specifically its eye patch, given today's politics. Know what I mean ?! Love the pizza, the people, and the place. Well worth the trip!

I've been going to Pequod's since I was a little kid, and it has remained the best pizza in a city full of great pizza.

The carmelized crust is fantastic, and the Pequod's spinach and mushroom deep dish might be the perfect food. The only downside to its recent notoriety is it's busier than it used to be, but it's still utterly wonderful.

My take on my recent Wednesday evening experience here is mixed

The Good:
The option to be able to call ahead and put your name on the list for a table is helpful
A few decent appetizer options to select from (fried zucchini was good)
Reasonably priced menu items
The restaurant is easy to find, and the surrounding neighborhood has plenty of free street parking
Their infamous pan pizza was a 8/10 for me as far as taste

The bad:
Hosts spent too much time talking with each other instead of welcoming customers into the restaurant (not efficient)
Waitress was almost non existent. She rarely came by, and when we needed her, she was hard to flag down
The personal cutting knife they brought me had paper and pieces of food on it (gross).

So overall I would say the food is good, but the service and cleanliness is questionable.

This is one of my favorite pizza places in Chicago! The caramelized crust pan pizza is delicious and reasonably priced. The place is always busy, especially during the weekends (can be up to 2 hour wait). However, while the pizza is delicious, the location itself needs some work (dirty tables, dirty bathroom, overall could be a cleaner atmosphere).

This was my second time having pequods! The first was a super great experience and everything was delicious. The second time around I went with a group. The service and food was terrible. We ordered appetizers that never arrived. Drinks weren't refilled. The pizza arrived super late and burnt!! We ordered a thin crust veggie and one with sausage. I'm hoping the third time is as good as the first time.

My Chicago tour included three different pizzerias in hopes of discovering the best: Lou Malnati's, Giordano's, and Pequod's. My favorite by far? Pequod's!

Each takes a little while to get from ordering to eating, making calling in ahead when possible a wise decision. But flavor? Ohhhh man. Technically a pan pizza I'm told, Pequod's is just dumped with everything the way I want it.

It looks a tad like a dive bar walking in, which probably has to do with the time of its founding. By the way, I kind of also like that there's only one location - it gives it more of an authentic, non-chained feel. Even if the service was, well, a little bit distant. Can't win in everything, and in this situation I didn't particularly care, probably due to the dive bar feel.

The best part? The pizza, obvi! The lunch special is somewhere around the $5-6 dollar mark (sorry, I forget), including a soft drink, which I didn't very much care for but gratefully accepted, a lemonade. The bread is thick and delicious, a slightly caramelized crust, and flavorful cheese and toppings hold the rest of it together. I threw on their sausages and mushrooms for an incredible delight.

When I move to Chicago, I know this will be my to-go spot for sure.

Overrated.  Took a Lyft way out of our way to get to this place based on the great reviews and then waited an hour for mediocre pizza at 9 PM. Gets three stars because the service and environment are good. But I'm from out of town in it for the pizza and frankly they're a lot better options where I'm from in San Francisco.  Won't be back.

Out of all the highly rated deep-dish spots we bookmarked ahead of time prior to visiting Chicago, this was our favorite pie.  It's a no frills type place and the wait can be easily over an hour and the pies take a bit to come out as well, but this is one place where the wait is worth it.  Our pies had a great crust, perfect amount of sauce, cheese and toppings, would definitely visit again-well worth the hype.

My FAVORITE pan pizza anywhere!  I order the same damn thing every time: pepperoni/mushrooms/green olives.  It brings me joy.  Like making guacamole, or listening to an old V-8 accelerate on LSD.

I especially like how the crust has burnt cheese on it. The pepperoni often has a bit if color too.

I will always be a fan!

Best deep dish in Chicago. Like most locals, this is a topic we take seriously!! I will fight you on this. Their burnt cheese crust does it for me. As an original Wisconsinite, cheese is important to me. My friends and I agree that Canadian bacon and pineapple here is the best but go crazy and get whatever you want. Add pepperocini!

Outside of the food being amazing - it's a fun atmosphere / sports bar. It's also unique and not a huge chain. If you have a weekday free go before 3PM for their awesome $5 personal pizza deal!

We made the fatal error of going to Lou's when ee got off the plane instead of going straight to Pequod's... but now we know the difference between sub par and excellent...

Ordered:
Thin Crust w/ sausage, mushroom and green peppers
Not ever going to order a thin crust pizza outside of NYC again! The dough tasted like the pillsbury instant dough....

Deep dish w/ pepperoni, meatball, green peppers and mushrooms.  Mucho bettero! Fresh ingredients, cheesy and the crust had a nice crunch. All worth the calories!

Wash it down with some of "Not your fathers root beer"

pics.caption: Deep dish w/meatballs, pepperoni, musrooms, green peppers and basil
Think crust, not worth the calories

review.des: I have heard about Pequod's Pizza from several friends as the best pizza in town. This is a very popular place and loved by many. I could tell from how crowded it was when I went to pick up my order. Although my pick up time was 7 PM, I was standing there in the restaurant along with many others for 45 minutes until my order was ready. The hostess made it sound that it was normal and she was unapologetic for the wait time. Putting that aside, I was extremely disappointed with this pizza. Its definitely not for everybody. I did not care for the crust or the ingredients. The sauce was pretty good but everything else tasted bland.

I'm not sure why this pizza is so talked about in Chicago! I had to see what the fuss was about, so I ordered a personal pepperoni deep dish and a thin slice of cheese (yes, I like food). The thin slice was just like any cheap greasy slice, nothing really to it. I was excited about the deep dish however, since I've heard great things. I have to say... this is NOT real Chicago style deep dish. It is a VERY thick slice of bread with minimal sauce and minimal cheese. Chicago style pizza should be minimal crust, and a whole lot of cheese. I was extremely disappointed.

pics.caption: I was more than disappointed... this is not chicago deep dish.... this is bread with sauce and sprinkled cheese.

review.des: True chicagoans choose Pequod's over other famous deep dish pizza places. It's fresh and delicious!
Pequod's is my favorite pizza place. I love their caramelized crust no other place can top it.

Delicious pizza!

I was in Chicago on business. My BFF from college brought me here with high hopes... And the pizza exceeded my expectations! Delicious! I will go back Everytime I visit.

The atmosphere: We got here before the rush on a Friday evening (around 6pm) so I can't complain about the wait, but shortly after it got very busy. All the take out order individuals cram into the small space which is uncomfortable for the seated patrons.
The pizza: Dry (almost burnt) crust. Like everyone else says, the ratio of bread to everything else on the pizza is too much. The cheese is very stringy and you feel like you have to chew each bite for ten minutes so you don't choke on it. For all the toppings I ordered there was zero flavor, where's the seasoning?
I've definitely had better and I wouldn't suggest this to a friend.

OOooh Pequods carmel crust.. i am gaining weight here.  A bit loud inside but the food is always good and we take the remains home for leftover that last all week.  In fact the pizza has an after life in the microwave oven.  Good stuff so take it home !
Holy smokes... that crust was amazing.  If I hadn't burnt my mouth trying to scarf this thing down, I'm sure it would have been even more magical.  Until next time.

We were excited to try a new deep dish pizza, but unfortunately were extremely disappointed. Our waitress seemed bothered by our request and was a bit rude. We ordered well done hot wings, were given regular BBQ wings, and when the waitress was informed, a different waiter bought out the same BBQ wings cooked a bit longer with the same BBQ sauce on it and some hot sauce on the side. A hair was found in one of our personal deep dish pizzas and the others weren't that great. Finally, splitting our bill was a big to do, we were charged more for the drinks when she split the check. We definitely won't be returning.
Did not disappoint! Loved the carmalized cheese and the sauce was super tasty! Can't wait to go back.

you can't go to chicago and not get DEEP DISH PIZZA! so on my short 3 day trip, my friends helped me decide that Pequod's would be the SOLE deep dish i tried in chicago

THE CRUST, lighter and more crumbly than i've ever had & with a blackened cheese layer on the top of the side, it was a good balance
--sausage deep dish: the sausage had a lot of anise but I loved how saucy this pizza was
--mushroom with fresh basil & tomatoes: not a fan of the sliced tomatoes but mushrooms never fail

LOVE that you can get personal pan sizes! i was pretty much full after 3/4th's of this pie

it's in a divey sports bar type atmosphere but don't underestimate
Really awesome alternative to the bigger guys like Lou's and Giardiano's. Also, their wings are super underrated

Refusing to serve alcohol to a group of people because you can't realize the difference in a disability and being inebriated. Joel, you're an idiot and have no business having anything to do with customer service. Shameful.

When I came to Chicago, I met up with a friend and asked her if we could get some good ole Chicago pizza.  I knew about Giordanno's and Lou Malnati's, but she suggested Pequods, which I never heard of.  Well turns out it was a great choice, and favored by the locals!

She said the line might be long, but we got seated pretty quick on a Fri night at 7.  No more than like 20 minutes.  Once we sat down, there were a lot of beers and then the pizza came out.  My god.  It was delicious.  It had that burnt crust taste and all that delicious sauce and fillings.  Next time I get deep dish in Chicago, this will be my first stop.

Of all the deep dish pizzas I've had while in Chicago, Pequod's comes out on top.  This is the only place that had a crispy crust!  The other places had a much more doughy consistency to them so Pequod's def stands out.  Since the waitress warned that the pizza takes a long time to cook (took about ~40 min)  My friends and I ordered the cheesy bread and chicken strips to help tie us over until the sausage/pepperoni pizza came.  The apps were nothing to write home about but my review is specifically for their deep dish pizza.  The toppings of the pizza was heavenly as well as all the cheese!  I managed to tackle 3.5 slices of that behemoth.  Hands down the best deep dish pizza I've ever had (and probably the longest food coma I've had as well).

The pizza is amazing and the wait was worth it.  The only problem is when the hype is so high you expect greatness.  I would've like the caramelization of the crust would've been done on all of the crust, not just the top.  The bottom layer was a little to thick and was inconsistent with the top layer.  But nonetheless it's definitely a worthy Chicago style pizza.

Everyone loves their thin crust pizza.  Many I know say it's the best in Chicago.  That's high praise.  It has almost a cult following.  I like it a lot.  I also like some other places for thin.  (This isn't Neapolitan thin, but just regular thin)
Best deep dish pizza in Chicago!! The crust is crunchy and the sauce is amazing!! Staff is friendly also!!
One of the best pizza places in Chicago.  The lunch special is a particularly good deal.

Well you've come to Chicago to try the world famous Chicago Deep Dish PIzza. Are you gonna go to a lame-duck chain restaurant like Uno's? No, I don't think so. You are gonna come to Pequod's to truly experience Deep Dish Pizza. Haven't tried other Deep Dish places in Chicago, but Pequod's lived up to their fame.

We made a reservation and we still had a long wait, so make your reservation as far in advance as you are able. Our waitress was great (split the check between a bunch of college kids' debit cards) and the pizza was delish! Loved the cornmeal crust :)

hefty portions of toppings on the 12" medium pan pizza we ordered. wait staff is extremely helpful and courteous.

came on a Saturday afternoon around lunch time, and didn't have to wait for find a table. there is plenty of room, including upstairs preferred seating!

If pizza preference measured my city pride I'd be a terrible Chicagoan. Thin crust has always been much more appetizing to me than a block of melted mozzarella. If I must dive into the deep dish though this is the spot I do it. Their caramelized crust really steps the experience up a notch.

They don't get the national recognition of Malnati's or Giordano's, but I promise you Pequod's is where it's at if you like feeling like you're pregnant after eating pizza. Lots of topping options, decent sauce to cheese ratio, and again of course that caramelized crust.

I don't often do pies this way, but when I do I choose Pequod's.
Good pie if your into deep dish

Made a reservation for a busy Saturday night. I highly recommend doing so if you're not up for an hour and a half + wait time. Honestly, I understand the whole concept of deep dish pizza--but Pequod's pizza had too much bread and not enough sauce and cheese. Everyone in my group agreed. We also got the cheesy bread: very basic Italian bread with mozzarella cheese and no special seasonings. I give three stars for the fact that we were able to order our pizza along with our reservation and they were already cooking our pizza when we arrived. Definitely cut down on wait time!

The pizza here is absolutely horrible. I don't get the hype on this place. But I tried it once and never again! The service sucked. Food took FOREVER for us to get it. And when it came it was super burnt and probably the worst pizza I've ever had.
Hair in salad and brown lettuce, item left off pizza, delivery late. Very dissatisfied.

I've been there a few times and their pizza is good. They did mess up the last time I was there, they forgot my order, I should have left, but decided to stay (the waitress should have been paying more attention). It feels like they rushed the pizza. About the only thing that is good is the pizza. Their appetizers are blah (mass produced food that gets deep fried), which is not good. Since you are waiting you want to probably enjoy some good appetizers in the meantime and they don't have that.

I usually love this place. This is my favorite deep dish in the city, mostly because they're made in those cast irons, which gives the crust a fantastic crispy caramelized exterior. One time I came, I got a pretty limp pizza though. Trying not to hold it against them.

Honestly, this is some of the best pizza that I've had in Chicago. I absolutely love the caramelized crust and flavor of these deep dish pizzas. The service is great and the atmosphere is pretty laid back. You can't call yourself a true Chicagoan if you haven't enjoyed Pequod's. And tourists, go out of the way to come here if you can.

Toppings,Cheese and Sauce very delicious really make the pizza more than decent, the crust tasted super buttery which wasn't the best combination with pizza but ok. The atmosphere was hectic due to Hawks game that was going on. Will definitely visit a quieter time next time.

Two words: Underwhelming. Disappointing.
But this review is solely for the "thin-crust" pizza.

I feel like I'm the only Chicagoan (or visitor of any kind) who has something bad to say but I have to say it for anyone who, like me, actually don't like thick pizzas. Sorry, Chicago, but I love me some NY-style pizza. It's the real thing. :P

I was with friends who wanted to try the place and thought I'd have a great experience like the many other patrons.

However, I guess my first mistake was getting the thin-crust, which is not what they're known for. As I am not a fan of other pizzas, I thought this would be my best bet. For the three of us, the pizzas took 45 minutes.

As soon as my pizza arrived, I was disappointed. It was not thin-crust at all. The outer edge where you hold it was really very cushiony, and the rest was just normal thickness. I knew I wouldn't find NY-style but Pequod's definition of thin-crust is way off.

But that wasn't really what bothered me. The flavor was just not there. There was nothing about the crust that tasted good (my friends who got pan pizzas said their crust was amazing, so I was envious!). It was really just like plain white bread. The cheese literally sat on the pizza in one sad, rubbery clump, not integrated with any of the vegetables I had selected (they tasted fine but were completely unseasoned). I could only stomach two slices as I was hungry before I just felt like I was eating cheap white bread with plasticy/fake white cheese. Honestly, I've had way better pizzas at Giordanos if you want to talk hyped-up places. Even Blaze Pizza, a franchise, turned out better. Not to mention Dimo's in Wrigleyville which has fantastic pizza. And, crust aside, they win when it comes solely to flavor.

My friends were happy with their pan pizzas, though. But if you only like NY-style pizza as I do, don't go even if your friends are raving about it. Let them experience it without you unless you're willing to go for the pan pizza (like I said, I can't speak to it, but I hear it's good and my friends who tried mine agreed it was pretty lame). It's totally not worth the wait and money.
After coming here two years ago, I was excited to come back. Unfortunately I was terribly disappointed! Completely tasteless and a strange consistency. Will not be back!

This place is famous for its pan pizza.  The caramelized layer of cheese for crust is what makes the pizza here special.  That being said, we had to check this place out!  

Upon walking in, I noticed that this place looked more like a bar, rather than a restaurant.  We were seated in a small booth meant for two.  The atmosphere was loud, but that was expected given the bar environment.  The appetizers and the pasta all looked so good.  But we knew we would not be able to finish them all, and still have room to try the amazing pizza!  So, the GF and I just decided we would just order the small pepperoni and mushroom pan pizza.

After waiting about fifteen minutes our pizza made its way to our table.  I was surprised with the short wait after because we had dined at Lou Malnati's the prior day.  Our server there  told us the pizza would take 45 minutes to cook.  I thought he was joking at first, but he was not kidding.

The pizza was downright delicious.  It was hands down the best deep dish I have ever had in my life.  There was nothing negative that could be said about the pizza.  It was not overly saucy, and they did not cheap out on the toppings.  I loved that the bottom of the pizza was crispy, and not soggy.  I had to use a knife and cut the bottom because it was just that crisp.  The crust was the best part.  It was still so hot, despite eating the crust last.  The cheese was heavenly, for lack of a better word.  

I love that this place opens until 2am.  The service was good, and the pizza was amazing.  I would recommend, and will definitely be back.

Always great and worth the wait! The pizza is amazing!!
Best pizza in the city hands down!
I will definitely be back again! Great Staff and Atmosphere!

I wish I could give this place a 3.5, but I'd rather give it a 4 than a 3. There are many pros and cons.

Pros: This place was HUGE. I was surprised to see that they're able to seat so many people. There is an entire section upstairs. It actually two separate sections. The service was good after we got seated. The pizza was decent but did not blow my mind. They tell you how long it will take to cook appetizers and the pizza which is excellent and much appreciated. Good french fries. Great prices on pizza! The crust was nice and fluffy! Even when I ate it cold the next day after I had it in my purse for 5 hours (don't judge me), it tasted great.

Cons: There are kind of a lot.
They told us 30 minutes to get seated (long), BUT the time was accurate and they actually sat us in 30 minutes. We ordered drinks and they came out quickly, but the drinks were pricey. I paid $5.95 for a pint, and those were the prices for almost all of their beers. We ordered half an order of fries and bruschetta. The fries were really tasty but I wish I had a bottle of ketchup rather than packets. The bruschetta was not good. It was bland and the bread had this weird orange color to it. I ordered a pan sized personal pizza and the size was perfect for me and I had half the pizza leftover. I ordered pepperoni with basil. My pizza was burned AND I really hate it when the basil is cooked with the pizza. Fresh basil should not be cooked in my opinion. The delicious taste of it goes away. It didn't taste fresh by any means :(

Overall, someone said we had to try it so we did. I'm not upset about it, I don't regret it, I may go back, but it didn't blow my mind.
Caramelized crust is the best ever!! this place is a chicago gem.

This was suggested to us by multiple people so we ordered in. They quoted us 1.5-2 hours but it took just over 1 hour on a Saturday night. The food had to be warmed up a little, but that just might be because I'm picky. Anyway, we got a medium half cheese, half sausage and green olives. Super good. The crust is more bready than a traditional deep dish style, but the flavoring of the crust is very good. The olives added delicious flavor too. Their cheesy garlic bread was also pretty good! Not just dry bread without flavor. It was a nice lil app. I'd probably come back again and try some other pizzas!

We were very disappointed in our pizza. It was so thick and doughy. The sauce was nothing special and the toppings were sparse. It was mostly bread. There was mention of cheesy crust. This was just burned crust.

After reading all the recommendations it was surprisingly bad.  We did not eat our pizza and neither did our dog when we took it home.  I just felt compelled to add our opinions. There were four of us and we were all in agreement. We will not go back.

And we waited close to two hours to get in.

Kind of disappointed by the pizza here. It was good, but there was too much dough for my taste. My friends loved the place though. If you like a cornmeal crust then this is definitely the place for you.

So we see all these fabulous review to be extremely disappointed. Delivery took 1 hour 50 mins and pizza was not good - crust was awful.
On top of all, they forgot to bring the appetizer for delivery and will not provide full refund. Will NOT return

When I was visiting Chicago, I wanted to try this famed establishment. I got this pizza delivered to the hotel, which arrived in a timely fashion and was still very hot. I was not a fan of their toppings... the green peppers were in huge chunks and the whole pizza was covered in a thick layer of pepperoni. When I started eating it, I realized that this is not traditional Chicago deep dish (which is my own fault, their website says they make pan pizza). The dough was super thick and soggy. Total deal-breaker.
Loved it! Pizza was delicious and highly recommend the zucchini bites (ask for a side of marinara to go with the ranch). Prices were fair, good atmosphere!
Pequod's is the best in Chicago. Tremendous pizza, truly Chicago. I recommend this to anyone, for what it's worth.

Heard great things, decided to order and have it delivered. When we called we were advised it would take 1hr 45 minutes  - 2 hours, no big deal. When 2 1/2 hours passed and still no delivery, we called only to be told they were really busy and short delivery drivers. Driver showed up 3 hours after we ordered and had a meltdown in the lobby of our building, refusing to bring the pizza to our door and left with the pizza. Needless to say, there are too many other good pizza places in Chicago to deal with this, you only get one chance, never again.

The lines to get into this place in the evenings are insaaaaane. That's probably the one reason why I felt like I had to get in here b/c I was too afraid I'd be missing out on the Chicago deep dish experience (having already been disappointed by Giordano's and Lou Malnati's).

When I finally got my pan pizza (Sausage, Spinach, and Mushroom) admittedly it looked awesome and when my slice was served, the stretch on the cheese could've gone across the room, but wow the pizza was...bland! The sauce wasn't intensely flavored and they were pretty stingy on the sausage. Not only that the pizza pie dough itself wasn't very flavorful; didn't have that yeasty quality you'd expect. They advertise the caramelization on the side of the pizza, which they delivered on, but ultimately that flavor didn't penetrate into the rest of the dough, which left for a less than amazing experience.

For better deep dish pizza...Art of Pizza.

Don't fall for the hype....

A great surprise, my boyfriend and I walked in expecting to wait over an hr for a table but got seated immediately. We were so surprised I even asked the waitress if this was peqouds lolol. So, yay for that.

Now onto the important stuff, the pizza. My boyfriend and I ordered a customized pan pizza and it was disappointing. It was a very average pan pizza, I have had better. Usually I will scarf down pizza but last night I only ate a slice because I was so disappointed I didn't want to bother anymore. So there you have it- not all that great.

Their crust is way too much, the pizza is literally 80% crust 13% tomato and cheese and 7% toppings- I need less crust and more tomatoes, cheese and toppings please

Won't be coming back
