OMG.... Go late so you don't have to deal with as crazy of a wait. We stopped in around 11PM; and still had to wait. When the place was pretty empty. *scratches head* that didn't make sense... and the hostess had all sorts of weird excuses about why we had to wait.

Anyway... we got the bbq chicken wings with ranch and an order of their to die for pizza.

Absolutely. Amazeballs. Usually with deep dish pizza, the first slice has the perfect balance of crunchy outside crust, with fluffy insides, balanced with tomato sauce and toppings and gooey cheese. Second slice is usually soggy and not so fantastic. Pequods still kept its texture and crunch when I tackled the second slice! That is something that's never happened before....

This whole in the wall looking restaurant that's not located in downtown Chicago had the best deep dish pizza I've ever had.

Definite must for any trip to Chicago!

Differs from other deep dish pizza because the crust at pequods is fluffier and more doughy. There also seemed to be more sauce. I highly recommend trying. However, the restaurant itself is on the smaller side and there was a long wait on Friday night.

I'm only giving it two stars because the staff was nice and the garlic bread was good.  Given the reviews and the line, I was absolutely in shock about the rest of the food.  The pizza was terrible.  Utterly tasteless.  Seriously, Dominos is better.  Completely disappointed.

I've been in chicago for 6 years now and this is definitely the best pizza I've had so far! Their deep dish crust is amazing. We had both a cheese pizza and a supreme both were awesome. I like the busy dive local feel of the place as well. Service was great and I highly recommend it!

After a movie at Webster this place is awesome.  If you like deep dish pizza with that crispy edge of cheese... oh yeah!  Decent prices and a great lunch special for a slice and drink. There can be a wait sometimes which sucks, but the pizza.... YUMMY!
Not sure if this is authentic Chicago pizza but it is probably the best I've ever had.
The best pizza! Love this crispy cheese heaven. The wait is long, but always worth it.

Incredible deep-dish. My friend was visiting and had never been to Chicago, so this was a great introduction into Chicago style pizza. We loved the sausage and the consistency, I would definitely order the pizza again--but only for take-out. We had been warned about the wait which was crazy, but the sheer noise from inside the bar when we went in to pick up the pizza was overwhelming. There is no way that you could eat or have a conversation comfortably--take out all the way!

Pequods is my guilty pleasure. I. Effing. Love. This. Place. As a Chicagoan, I don't understand how people can still be hung up on Lou's and Gio's with this place around, they pale in comparison. The thin crust here is good but the deep dish pan pizza is to die for! It has a caramelized crust and is cooked to perfection every time. This place never disappoints and by the way, they have a very generous delivery range. My only regret is that it's socially unacceptable to eat pizza everyday so I have to space my Pequods visits adequately.

As good as it gets! I have gluten and dairy issues so I don't eat pizza very often, but when I do, I prefer Pequod's over everything else. I used to go here after concerts and they'd be slammed, but I'd wait an hour anyway!

Overrated. I went on a Friday night with a group of 8. We called ahead for priority seating which worked out well. However, when we got to our table we noticed that there were a lot of open tables and there were lots of people waiting outside. It seemed like they were trying to make people wait unnecessarily or there was not enough employees. Our waitress had way too many tables and didn't pay much attention to us after we ordered our food. It took us 25 minutes to get the check because our waitress was swamped. We were given pitchers of water at the beginning of the night that were never refilled. This place is trendy and appeals to a younger crowd however they don't value an exceptional customer experience. I got a snooty vibe and felt that the employees think that customers should be honored to get a table. The pizza was good but I wouldn't recommend it to tourists who have never tried deep dish as the pizza was more of a pan style. Overall, don't believe the hype.
Pizza was wonderful. A little tight quarters but who cares the service was great. Great place to sample Chicago pizza!  Here after a wedding rehearsal.

Really like this place. The crust of this pizza is the best thing ever. The pizza tastes really fresh but sadly takes 45 minutes to make! I would suggest coming here right when Pequod's opens BEFORE everyone files in for the football game happening that weekend. Another thing, if you're really into cheese, Pequod's is not the cheesiest of the deep dish places. So, if you're looking for something like that, I'd either get the cheese pizza (or ask for more cheese) or check out Lou Malnati's or Giordano's.

Best Pan Pizza I've had in Chicago (so far). Real good flavor, nice crust, even a bit light (for pan pizza).  Rest of the menu was okay.  Nothing special, bit definitely worth the trip (and probably wait) for the pie..

I loved this place.  We went last night and the pizza and service were outstanding.  I'd like to give a particular shout out to the management, who, upon hearing that I (like an idiot) dropped my phone behind the booth, came out to help me at the end of our meal by deconstructing the booth and using a broom handle to Macgyver my phone from its hiding place.  I was mortified, but the staff was so kind and patient and never made me feel bad.  Also, though I offered an extra tip for their help, the manager refused to take it.  The willingness of Pequad's to go above and beyond the call of duty has earned them my lifelong loyalty.

Pizza tastes good but it's too much bread and not enough cheese. Salads are fine but the apps are below-bar-quality. The bathrooms are disgusting but I guess this is really more of a sports bar with pizza than a restaurant. Service is uneven which I suppose is understandable given what a madhouse this place usually is. Have not tried delivery because I don't want to wait that long.
LOVE.  Different style than other Chicago pizza, so expect different but carmelized cheese on crust can't be beat.
I like it, it's unique, beats all the other deep dish in town but the flavor does get boring after awhile and it's really expensive to add toppings

So on my road trip to Notre Dame I had to sample Chicago Deep Dish pizza. I have tried several and if I rate those a four I have to rate this place a 5!!!!  Secret to going to these top pizza places is to go on off times and early. This place luckily takes reservations but it is small inside and a tavern feel vs other places that are true restaurants. We sampled the thin crust (which in my mind is still thicker than most pizza) and the traditional Deep Dish. If I were to come back again and I will it is deep dish hands down. The crust and sauce are melting with flavors all around. This place is truly amazing. Again small place, tavern feel but of course kids are allowed.  Also if you are stopping by before a Cubs game and score parking Uber or Lyft to game.

pics.caption: Thin crust is good but not as good as deep

review.des:
Hands down, unequivocally the best deep dish pizza period. There is no equal, I have eaten and eat a lot of pizza and nothing on this planet compares to a Pequod's pepperoni deep dish pizza. The caramelized cheese is amazing!!!

Fun to eat inside, the place has character. You may wait a bit for your freshly made, delicious caramelized crust pizza, but it is worth every second.

Great tasting bubbly fountain soda awaits to refresh your palate.

His place has the best pizza in Chicago hands down. What makes this place different is the way they make pizza. The sauce is amazing and full of favor. They caramelize cheese on the crust which captures the flavors amazingly. I have ate pizza from several locations and I have yet to find something as good as this location.

Some advice:
1. If you are coming on Friday or Saturday night, you will have to wait up to an hour to get in. This may seem like a long time, but there is a reason people wait. You can call ahead and have priority seating, which can shorten your wait.
2. My personal opinion, the more ingredients you place on the pizza the soggier it will get. Less in this case is more.
3. If there are any major Chicago sporting events, it will be packed.
4. Parking is rough at times. Drive on the street behind, there are more chances of finding parking there.

pics.caption: Crust is the best part! EAT IT!

review.des:
Oh my Quod, buckle up for what may be the most ridiculous food experience I'll ever have.

7p - Called in a delivery order for a small deep dish and bruschetta. Told it'll take about 90 minutes.

8:45p - Called back to inquire and sat on hold for five minutes. Never a good sign. They say the pizza will be out the door in ten minutes and we're promised some kind of discount on the check (card was already charged). Aka the order was lost and they just put it in. We didn't expect it to actually be out the door in ten minutes, but nonetheless proceeded with that thought.

9:30p - Call #3. My apartment is about 3 miles/15 minute drive from Pequod's, so it should have been here about 9:10 if their previous timeline is to be believed. Turns out the driver had the wrong number and couldn't get ahold of us so they drove back. Gave them the number once again and waited, wondering if death was nigh.

10p - If the driver was headed right back out with our order, they should have been here by now. We get the same answer as before, which we're quick to shoot down since 10 minutes ago was 20 minutes ago. The entire charge has been voided, thankfully.

10:45p - Call #5 (!!!!!!!) At this point we kind of just want to go to bed, but know we need to eat. We're finally given the manager again. This is only the second time we've spoken to him, the first being a brief apology during call #2. He apologizes profusely but you can tell he's basically at a loss for words at this point (can't blame him). No idea what happened to our order but he's going to put another pizza in. He also takes down our information and we can get a free order in the future (don't think that'll get used).

11:30p - The driver finally arrives. For those keeping score at home, it took 4.5 hours to get our order. Of course, this happened when I had less than zero food in the house so we had to commit to waiting this out.

Here's the worst part after all of this - it wasn't good at all. The pizza was predictably terrible since it probably went through the oven at a billion degrees to get it out. It's probably decent in normal form, but not better than the other deep dish places. Disappointing given all the rave reviews I've heard.

Never, EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEVER (shout out to Chris Jericho) order the bruschetta. It was actually kind of hilarious. Uncooked bread slices that had been oiled and a salsa cup of what was basically pico de gallo. Chopped tomato and onion with no seasoning. Sad panda.

Clearly Pequod's has earned many fans over the years, but maybe your best course would be to tread lightly.

I have been dying to try Pequods, and I finally did.  First of all, I prefer thin crust but everyone said I would love this deep dish.  Yes, it is probably the better of the deep dishes I have had but I was really disappointed in their sauce.  The sauce was super bland and lacked seasoning and spice which kind of ruined the whole pizza for me because it wasn't very flavorful.  I did really enjoy the caramelized crust; it was the best part

Any time we have family/friends visiting from out of town, this is where we get their deep dish fix! Expect to wait to get in (a few spots around you can hang out at) and it takes about 45 minutes to cook the pizza. This is not bad service, it's typical so just be prepared. Their appetizers are really good --- the cheesy bread is super delicious. The place is nothing fancy but is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Their crust is what makes it!

Whoever said real Chicagoans don't eat deep dish is a liar. Pequod's is my go-to at least once a month. That caramelized crust is what dreams are made of. I recommend getting your pie with extra sauce, as I find the leftovers are better that way.
Great pizza!! Service was really good! Definetly will be craving the deep dish very soon!

In a nutshell: Chicago deep dish in Wicker Park.

Came here with family, as it was highly recommended and we were driving through the area. Pequod's is located caddy corner to a fairly new shopping center, with a movie theatre, Barnes and Nobles, etc.

Parking 3/5
Fairly easy. Found street parking a couple blocks down. There is lot parking across the street, but we didn't want to have to pay.

Ambience 3/5
The place essentially looks like a long sports bar (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…). Bar on the left as you walk in, and most or all of the tables are stool height. Restrooms are in the back across from the kitchen and are pretty clean for a sports bar.

Service 4.5/5
Actually really good. This earned them the fourth star for me. Our server was really nice, and checked in with us pretty regularly. There was a mix up with our order (I'll get to that later), but she fixed it by giving us half off our food bill. She didn't have too, but the fact that she did was pretty awesome of her.

Wait time 1/5
Seating - B
Waited about 20 minutes for seats. Not bad

Drinks - A
Ordered a pitcher of 312 of the menu (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…) and this came out quick.

Food - F
Expect to wait longer for deep dish, but this time there was a mix up with our order. The tables around us all got their food before us. We ended up not getting our food for almost an hour and a half. By the time it showed up we were hungry and grumpy. However, we were not as grumpy as we could have been, as the server told us beforehand that she would take half off the price of food for us.

Food 4/5
Jalapeno poppers - 3/5
They didn't suck and they tied us over.....kind of.

Large Pepperoni Sausage and Onion (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…) - A
Bomb. Very comparable to Lou Malnati's. I'm a huge fan of deep dish, since I don't eat it very often. I'm not a big fan of pepperoni in general (shame on me), but everyone else wanted it.

Small Sausage Mushroom and Basil (yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…) - A-
Very tasty but the crust was a bit burnt. Not enough to make it a crappy meal, but then again we had been waiting for over an hour for this.

Overall 4/5
Food was good, and the service staff did an amazing job trying to make us happy despite of the mix up in the kitchen. Sometimes $h!t happens, but it's all about how they react to it that sets them above other restaurants. Happy with the experience, and I would definitely come back here.
Great pizza! I take all my out of town guests here when the visit. Its a laid-back bar atmosphere, not too loud, and always busy.
If Jesus Christ himself were resurrected in these times, his first stop would be here for the Pizza.

This is my favorite deep dish spot in the city- bar none. Plus, I love that it's located right next to the Webster theatre- makes for the perfect post movie lunch or dinner. I usually stick with the classic pepperoni, but sometimes will opt for sausage, green peppers and onions. The later can be a bit messy with all the toppings but it's always delicious none the less.

I only make it to Chicago every couple years and try to find a new pizza spot each time.  This is easily my new favorite place.  Pizza takes a little while to cook but they tell you this and it's expected.  Prices are easily worth inline and I recommend doing their online "call ahead".  The cheese that melts and chars around the edges really makes it!

I had the pleasure of trying this joint not too long ago, and it was pretty good. We ended up going around dinner time on a Saturday and yikes...the wait was three hours for a dinner table! However, to get your pizza-to-go it was only an hour and so we settled. Our pizza was topped with spinach, garlic, and Italian sausage (those three go great together). The crust was something different from what I'm used to, it wasn't bad but I don't know if I absolutely loved it. I'd definitely return on a less busy evening to review on service, but I definitely think you should give it a try!
Best Pizza in Chicago. Go to: mushrooms and meatballs Deep Dish (meatballs are super underrated there, but really good).
Favorite pizza anytime I come to Chicago. Hands down what Chicago deep dish is made famous for
By far one of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago! I love that you can add lots of different toppings and that it's not too doughy. It's a must for all tourists visiting Chicago!

Stinky. Saw my waitress 3 times. Walked in and the wait for a pizza said 40 minutes. Only bright side was sitting down immediately, however we waited over hour for pizza after we ordered. When the pizzas got there, one pan pepperoni and one thin crust cheese, it was mediocre. The only highlight of the pan pizza was the amount of pepperoni, which you could taste.  The cheese was barely there and was baked into the crust, with the rest of it tasting like cardboard. The thin crust stunk, wanted to get it off my plate. No flavor at all. To top it all off, we missed the first couple minutes of the Bulls game to see the Red Wings and the Flyers. Very disappointing as a Chicago lifer. The hype isn't worth it, find some other place to dine.

Winter is coming, and what better way to prepare for hibernation with a delectable dairy dish! The deep dish pizzas are worth the wait at this hole in the wall sports bar in Oldtown Chicago.

These heaping mounds of sauce, cheese, and your choice of toppings are definitely not what the Italians envisioned when they invented the first pizza. Order your choice of a small, medium, or large platter either to share or devour yourself. But beware, this decadent dish packs a punch. I've seen many a ill-fated customer loosen 1 or 2 belt buckles after trying to conquer these savory behemoths.

What I recommend you to do is gather 2 of your most lactose tolerant friends, order yourselves a medium deep dish with sausage, green peppers, and of course, Pequods own freshly grown Chicago basil and prepare for a scrumptious dish.
Awesome lunch special. One of the best in the  city. And the pizza is excellent. Does get packed. How can you beat that price though?

This place is deservedly well known for its pizza, I've never had a better deep dish pizza crust. Which is why I gave it two stars instead of one. That said, there are MAANY issues in this establishment which will make me and many of the other customers who gave up and left that night never come back.

First off, the management of the way this place is run is absolutely horrible. People were waiting 2 to 2 and a half hours and being told it would be an hour and a half. Then, people who called in got bumped ahead of everyone else who had ALREADY been waiting for a ridiculous amount of time. Everyone was upset, there was a small uprising, and it made for a very stressful environment. Managers, get your staff and yourselves organized because that was a mess.

Second, the place is completely understaffed. There was one hostess for hordes of people trying to ask questions and get their names down. Waitress were given so many tables and people to attend to that they had just enough time to drop your plate and run to the next table, so we could barely get in questions about getting more drinks or more food. The staff were extremely stressed and overwhelmed.

The stressful and frustrating experience is not worth it. The pizza is good, but not good enough for that to be ok. Take better care of your customers, because in that one night I saw at least five groups, not including mine, decide they weren't returning, and for good reason.

One of the best pizzas of my life.  It's like a Ferrari of pizzas.  You can tell that they put in a lot of work and amazing ingredients to perfect their recipe.

But to cover the whole experience.  This place is awesome.  It has two bars.  One upstairs and one downstairs along with seating for eating in both.  It is like a dive bar, that happens to serve some of the best pizza in the world.  Let's just say if I lived within walking distance, I would be here far too often! :)

Drinks were good too.  They have blue moon on tap and make cocktails.  Oh, and the sausage pizza is what we had and it is a must because I think they make their own sausage because it was mike mama's meat balls on there.

If you live in Chicago or within 50 miles of this place and haven't tried it then you are missing out.  There is a reason why it was voted top 10 pizzas in America.

pics.caption: Sausage and mushroom deep dish.  One of the best pizzas of my life.

review.des:
One of my favorite places for pizza. Deep dish. Thin. You name it. It's freakin' delicious.
Whenever someone is new to Chicago and asks what place is good for pizza. Say Pequod's.
I love the buttery crust.. the edges are nicely caramelized and crispy..
The wonderful cheese to sauce to topping to dough ratio is just right.
Their selection of craft beer is great to go with your hearty pizza too.
It's Hawks season so when you go here on a weeknight expect it to be busy.
I love this place. It's always satisfying.

Man, this place is kick ass. It has a real, local feel from the exposed brick walls to the staff and people inside. Nothing fancy or hip bit feels like a place where real deep dish pizza is made the same way they've been doing for decades (could be wrong). The service was really great. Not overly attentive or anything but a casual sense about it. Three guys total, after a night out, we split a medium deep dish with Canadian bacon, pepperoni, spinach and sausage. 6 slices total and 2 slices each and the waitress was absolutely correct-totally enough. Proved us wrong when we thought of doing two pizza pies. The pizza was absolutely savory and delicious. Thick and heavy with a crunchy harder exterior and a chewy soft doughy bread on the inside and amazing toppings. Not the kind you grab with your hand and bite in 3 goes. Definitely a knife and fork sitch. Also, great value for the yums - $30 for a medium with five toppings. Left very satisfied.

This is my favorite pizza in Chicago, hands-down.  It is light and fresh, without the greasy crust most chains have.  I also love the atmosphere; it is very casual and friendly.  It does have long wait times, but it's worth the wait!

This place would easily get 5 stars for the food. The pizza is delicious and I am hundreds of miles away and want to eat another one right now. However, the service is abysmal! Waited more than the 45 minute wait for 1 small pizza for pick up. Why on earth does it take that long? Actually, if I place my order now, it should be ready when I get there after a four hour flight

Pizza is good, but be prepared to wait and wait and wait. I would go there when you think you'll be hungry in an hour or so. Do not go there when you are already hungry, or you will be miserable.

Terrible service and food. I ordered deep dish for delivery. I asked for Italian beef as a topping and when it was delivered it was sausage. I do not eat sausage so I called to ask for a new pizza. At first the lady said sorry there's nothing they can do about it as the receipt says sausage. I specifically said Italian beef. They sent a second pizza after 1.5 hours and it was soggy and gross. Frozen grocery store pizza would have tasted better than this! So disappointing...especially because I had guest in town and this totally ruined their Chicago pizza experience.

I never fathomed giving my favorite pizza joint in the entire city of Chicago three stars, but I am. The pizza continues to be stellar, but the service has gotten bad. Really bad.

On my second to last visit, July 25 for lunch, our server was also the bartender. She was very unfriendly and acted like we were a bother. Then, to top it off, our lunchtime special pizzas arrived with the wrong toppings.

Fast forward to a couple days ago, September 4 in the early evening, when our pizza again arrived with the wrong toppings. We had to ask twice for refills because the server forgot. And the pizza took 1.5+ hours, nearing two hours! We were told because it had "a lot of toppings." I've been going to Pequods for almost 10 years, ordered very similar pizzas, and never heard that excuse. Do you mean you forgot to put in the order, perhaps? Or maybe the kitchen messed it up? Who knows what happened, but when waiting a total of 2.5+ hours, it was disappointing to end up with the wrong pizza.

I recommend the servers repeat back the toppings to customers. I know Pequods has a loyal following (that was once me) but you can't let service fall by the wayside.

New favorite pizza place in the city! Although the wait times can be lengthy around lunch time the wait is completely worth it! The lunch special is a wonderful deal and pequods offers a nice selection of drinks and desserts. The only downsides I can think of the is the long wait time for the food (pan pizza takes a long time to make) and the low light. Will be back soon whenever I'm in Lincoln park!

Absolute best pizza in Chicago!!  The caramelized crust proves that mistakes can yield amazing things - it's what sets their pizza apart from all the competition here!  And it's definitely worth the wait (to sit down b/c they're always busy, and for the pizza itself!).  :-D

This is some great Chicago deep-dish pizza. The choice of toppings is fantastic, and the portion sizes very generous for a great price. We were a group of six in for some lunchtime pizza, and I was amazed at the amount of food we got in two pizzas. We couldn't finish everything, but taking away was no problem.

The place is fairly small and very busy, so we did have to queue for some time outside, but it was worth the wait. Just keep this in mind if you're planning to visit, especially in a large group.

I hate deep dish. I don't care for it. I don't like all the cheese, the sauce, and the bread. BUT, Pequod's is THE ONLY place I will eat deep dish at. They do it the best!

TIP: If you're going on a Saturday night, make sure you get there early, we got there around 5:30pm and we still waited about 20-30 minutes for a table. The environment is loud and busy, so if you wanted a "romantic quiet sit down," this is not the place for you. Anyways, the pizza is made fresh and will take about 40+ minutes until you get it, but I must say IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. I shared a small with another person, and it was enough since I personally don't eat much. I had 1.5 slices and I was quite full.

Their service is amazing as well, our waitress was super nice and attentive even though it was so busy inside.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Pequod's. BEST deep dish in the city, hands down!

Best deep dish in the city. Hands down phenomenal and amazing. The crust, the thickness and the sausage are everything. I'm a tough critic when it comes to pizza but this is thee best deep dish I've ever had. The only deep dish I eat and forever the undefeated deep dish champ. So much yes

If you're ever craving some pizza-topped bread, this is the place to go! I mean that in the best way possible though, because man on man, that crust! Like other reviewers have said, this deep dish is a THICK layer of crust topped with some sauce, gooey cheese, and your choice of toppings. The texture is really great, though I think either the crust or sauce could have done with a bit more flavor.
This is my second favorite deep dish in Chicago so far, and next time I'm down for some carb overload, I'll return!

We absolutely love the food (and convenience) of this place! However, we gotta be real. The pizza is good, but it's not like, g o o d like everyone says it is. And the waitstaff has continuously been so incredibly rude whenever we are there. We live 500 ft away, so we'll go back, but it's never our first choice.

Food was good but massive mess up the one thing I was adamant about was that there was no cheese on any of the salads what was there to much cheese for my vegan girlfriend to notice. Good going guys.

Also pineapple is not a veggie it's a fruit.
Excellent deep dish, a bit like Lou's but cheesier and the cheese is carmelized on the sides of the pizza. Great first impression!

I have never dined in, and can only speak for delivery. But if delivery pizza is this good then I can only assume it's the same as dining in. I absolutely love their deep dish! The crust and bread is ridiculously buttery and worth the calories. I like to get the deep dish with pepperoni, with green and red peppers. Tell them to make the pizza well done- gives it that extra crisp!

pics.caption: Medium deep dish with pepperoni and green & red peppers. Ask for your deep dish, "well done". Gives it an extra crisp! So good!

review.des: This is my absolute favorite pizza joint in Chicago. They use only the best ingredients. I love the bread and caramelized crust. The sausage is the best. The sauce is outstanding. Just the right amount of everything. Be sure to order just enough to get full and take some home for lunch the next day.
Bar none best pizza in Chicago! The Skokie location is cash only, but so worth the hassle!

What a fun and lively place to go out to eat for some classic Chicago style zaaa!

I arrived with a group of 4 on a Tuesday night. Pequod's was busy (as to be expected). We were able to get our first round of drinks from the bar while we waited to be seated. I was very content with the speed of the service from the bartender.

Once we were seated, the waitress greeted us promptly and helped us with the menu a bit. She was quick and efficient. Over all the service was immaculate for how busy the restaurant was. Well done.

Now on to the food.
We ordered bruschetta, wings, and a 12" traditional style pizza with spinach, onion, green pepper and onion. The bruschetta was buttery and light. The wings had a killer buffalo sauce that I would like to purchase to my own use at home. The deep dish pizza was to die for. The crust was super crispy but the dough and cheese in the middle was warm and gooey. Perfect for a cold winter night. Something about their recipe just screams true Chicago deep dish.

I would recommend this place to anyone who's got a craving or wants to show some out of towners how Chicago does pizza.

The lunch special available on weekdays -- $5 cheese pizza with choice of pop -- is the best. I visited Pequod's with a family member and we weren't disappointed. Friendly wait service. You may have to wait for it to cook, but it's worth it.

Cheese crusted deep dish. Bam. My first ever legit deep dish chicago style pizza in the city of chicago. I can't compare it to any other "best chicago style pizza" joints since I didn't have time to check those out but my foodie local friend took us here because, "once you have cheese crusted deep dish why would you ever go back?"

to lighten it up, i got only veggies on mine and it was nothing short of blissful heavenly pizza. my husband had the meat heavy topping and he enjoyed both styles.

con: the immensely long wait. we sat down and waited for an eternity (maybe 45 min?) to get our pizza. but, it was also during the nhl play offs so the place was packed (chicago vs la) so perhaps it was just due to overcapacity.

great, now i'm dreaming of this place.

Let the debate begin!  I had the deep dish with sausage because that's one of my favorites at Lou Malnati's which is at the top of my list.  I heard about Pequod's famous crust, and I have to say I did enjoy it.  There is definitely more crust to the pizza than other deep dish joints.  For example, Giordano's has got the thick layer of cheese making up most of their slice.  Malnati's has equal amount of cheese and sauce.  At Pequod's, it's crust.

Don't get me wrong, there's sauce and cheese but not as much as the other places, so know that going into it.  Now the sauce was great.  Right up there with Malnati's.  At Giordano's the sauce has this kind of burnt/baked on feel to it which is still good.  The sauce here was very tomatoey like Malnati's and tasted fresh.  Now for the sausage.  It tasted great and I just wanted more.  Maybe it's because it was a personal sized pizza.

Overall, really enjoyed it.  It was one I hadn't tried after living in Chicago for so long, and I'm glad I tried it.  However, it's behind Lou Malnati's and Giordano's for me.

Overall disappointed. A group of six of us were excited to enjoy Pequod's pizza after seeing a movie across the street earlier tonight; the pizza fulfilled our cravings but the service left us hungry for attention. We were expecting a decent wait since six of us were going around dinner time; fortunately, the wait was only around 15-20 minutes. But then realized this table was open when we originally checked in with the host staff.

Our server mentioned the pizza would take about 45 minutes and suggested the combo appetizer plate while we waited. We did order it but wouldn't suggest spending money on it. We expected the wait for the pizza to be around 45 minutes as she mentioned but in the end it took well over an hour. During our wait we asked the host staff if the Cubs game could be turned on since the Bears game was on every other TV. The original TV we asked for it to be put on was denied; however, they did put it on another TV nearby but only for 5 minutes before another guest said they wanted to watch the Bears. Considering they have several TVs which all had the Bears game on, having the Cubs who had a better chance at winning the game (and did!) didn't seem to much to ask.

It took forever for us to receive our bill. The bill also included a drink that one of us ordered although it was never delivered. When we mentioned that to our waitress she first questioned us but then apologized and removed it from the bill.

Overall the pizza was good; however, the service needs a lot of improvement before we will return.

My favorite pizza place of all time! You can't get a better Chicago style deep dish pizza anywhere! The crust is perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The place is always jammed pack, and I wonder why..!!! The service is delightful. It takes about an hour to cook these bad boys, so make sure to order before you get to the restaurant. They need to expand this place to the suburbs so I can eat here more frequently! Love my za!

My husband and I wanted to try a deep dish pizza before we left Chicago so because of all the good reviews, we chose this place.

Let's start off, I love the atmosphere and the vibe of this place. I wish they had a bigger bar though, for both upstairs and downstairs.

We made our own deep dish of spinach, chicken, and mushrooms. The sauce was bland and watery. The bread was a lil too chewy as well. Along with the disappointment of the pizza, we also got the pizza bread which is like bread sticks. My husband really liked it.

Overall, if I come back to the city, I'm gonna find a different place to get deep dish pizza.

WORTH THE WAIT!

I'm pretty sure i visited Chicago about three or four times before finally getting a taste of a deep dish pizza. To my delight, my boyfriend's family knew exactly where to go!

If you're going to go here on a weekend (which we did), be prepared to wait for and hour or two depending on the time you get there. Luckily, there are a lot of bars and other areas you can chill and have drink while you're waiting for them to buzz you (just make sure your buzzer is still within their radius)

We waited about two hours until we were finally seated. They actually have a lot of space in their building. Our table was on the second floor which i preferred more. Plus! if you go to the bathroom, they have a lord of the rings wall decor- at least the women's bathroom did...i didn't check the men's haha

ANYWAY, as for the food. we ordered drinks and the Pequod's salad, which was a great light start considering we were going to carb central with all the pizza. We ordered two medium sized deep dished pizza. There were five of us and each of us ate around two slices and still had leftovers! One pizza has mushrooms, garlic and sausage. The other pizza was a simple pepperoni and cheese, but we asked for anchovies on the side as well. The pizzas itself was amazing! The dough they use is lighter than i expected, almost like focaccia but not as soft. They carmelize the crust which gives a great crunch at the end. As for the toppings, the sausage was delicious but the garlic just made that one pizza. So DO put garlic! The pepperoni and cheese was an awesome classic as well, and the anchovies was a nice touch when you add it.

Overall, I was very satisfied and glad I came here for my first ever experience of a Chicago deep dish pizza!

I don't get it.  People die for this sort of pizza.  Its not that good.  I can understand that people who love that cracker bread pizza like Lou's would really like this place, but I was not a very big fan.

Honest review: i liked ginos east better not worth the wait or the rude service.  My one star rating means i wouldnt come back not because its the worst pizza i ever ate when i give more then a star it means id go back
WARNING NO RESERVATIONS: they said u have to call and put ur name on the list that didnt do anything though cause we still got the beeper!!!! :( so a 30 minute wait turned into an hour!!!! Fml! Oh wait it gets better u cannot order ur pizza while u wait  so that means u gotta wait longerfinally hallelujah we get seated we order and guess what waiting again!!!!!!! shit litterly time stands still with all the waiting! regarding the service omg there all teenagers so there either dancing hanging out or hidding in the back caught them  funny moment. Our waiter was rude she put a bunch of utensils in a cup and slammed it down then no good recomendations or was nice at all just hi and bye n she forgot things i asked her for tabasco sauce and i was watching her just stand there n she came back a while later n im like can u plz get tabasco sauce one of the worst waiters ever avoid the pretty blond waiter .

Appetizer combo: comes with jalepeno poppers, mozzarella sticks, fried mushrooms and zucchini sticks. Surprisedly the breading on all of them is really good so that means there not frozen junk food! The seasoning on the breading is good wish it had a lil more seasoning  though. The only thing i didnt like was the zucchini it was really bland like really we didnt eat them just left them there. The marinara sauce it comes with is also really good.
Pan pizza: WARNING NO BACON TOPPING it came n i was like thank god im starving already cut so u dont have to struggle to eat the pizza the crust is good not to thick not to hard just like in the middle the sauce was really delicious like really the meatballs that were on it were really tender and flavorful but there was only 1 slice of a meatball on each cut of pizza the best part of the pizza is the burnt cheese crust it was really delicious like really for once i actually ate the crust and didnt discard it. The issues with the pizza was it needed salt badly my girlfriend hates salt yet even she was like wow gimme that salt shaker another issue was the actual pizza needed more cheese like there was a really serious problem with the ratio of condiments to crust when u think of deep dish u think 10 pounds of heaven not 10 pounds of crust
Amazing food! Amazing service! Always my go to stop for pizza! Can't go wrong here, listen it takes a while but well worth it! This place is literally the bomb

Definitely my favorite pan pizza place in Chicago! I would consider this more a pan pizza, but I can tell how it's a deep dish/pan mix. The crust looks burnt (but doesn't taste like it), and I think it's because of the deep dish pan they use. The crust is flakey and buttery, and holds up the slice just fine. I've always had the pizza cooked to perfection and taste amazing, they definitely don't cheap out on the toppings and load the pizza with what you want.

They also have an amazing in-house lunch special. Just make sure you have an hour, because it probably takes minimum 20 minutes to get the pizza out (fresh cooked). I ended up getting pepperoni/jalapeno and it was simply amazing. I believe it's a 7" personal pizza, so kudos to you if you can finish it off. It comes with a free soda as well, so it's a pretty amazing deal all around.

Check this place out if you love pizza and want to experience something different from the traditional thin crust/deep dish.

pics.caption: Lunch special, I got pepperoni & jalapeno (loved it)

review.des: Pizza is fantastic, and it's something I crave now. Best deep dish I've had so far. Like others say, the waits are something to consider, but we often do delivery anyway. The caramelized cheese is just so perfect - a bit crispy and a bit chewy and just fantastic flavor. Love the pizza. Delicious.

I went with an out of town guest. I'd heard this was the Chicago deep-dish to experience. I find that I prefer the kind with a flakey crust and piled toppings over this, at least when it comes to getting the Chicago deep-dish experience. Nothing wrong with Pequod's and the pizza was fine, I just would choose elsewhere for deep-dish.

Forever and always my favorite pizza in Chicago. I take everyone who comes from out-of-town to Peaqods. I've been to a child's birthday party in the space upstairs and it was amazing. Arrive before you get too hungry, cause the pizzas take a while to cook, but it's so worth the wait. Enjoy!

Ok so the way I explain this pizza is think of Beggars thick thin crust, but with seriously the best quality ingredients on the planet and cooked to a cheesy, crispy, crunchy state of perfection. The ingredients and the way they are cooked just make this pizza a new player. And it's fair to say it's the best thin crust, as it's totally different from deep dish. You have to try it.

I came here a few months ago and was pleased with the deep dish pizza. It wasn't some amazing  out of this world pizza. It was comparably less amazing than a pizza at Lou Malnati's or Giordano's or Gino's East. I do realize that grouping different pizzerias may be a sin, but the pizza from Pequod's is nothing extravagant.
Flash forward to a few days ago and the experience, and pizza was much different.
Our group consisting of four people had chosen to order a thin crust pizza because the wait time was well over 40 minutes.
We ordered a pizza with sausage and mushrooms on one side and various veggies on the other.
The pizza took almost an hour to arrive, and our waitress was less then accommodating.
When our pizza did arrive it was a glob of cheese that was soggy and really just disgusting to eat. Imagine the worst pizza you have ever eaten, and that was what we were served that day.
It was sad to be served such a unflattering pizza by a restaurant that supposedly makes good pizza...
I would've liked to have written a positive review on this restaurant, but I also wanted to show future customers the other side of the coin.
Overall, if you get a good server, and have the time to afford a deep dish pizza, you're golden. If not, you are eating at an overrated and underwhelming "pizzeria".
My favorite location for Chicago style pizza. Whenever I have out of towners this spot is always on my list of recommendations. The long wait is definitely worth it.

I'm a Chicago native so you can bet I have tried just about all of the Chicago Deep Dish pizza's out there. This is definitely my favorite of them all!

I have been coming here since the bar next door used to Flounders (currently called the Drinking Bird I believe?). When it was Flounders, the owners would let us bring the tasty goodness of their neighbor (if their kitchen was already closed) after drinking shenanigins with close friends. Which of course always tasted like heaven.

Whether or not I have had an adult beverage or not, this my favorite of all deep dish pizza's. The caramelized crust is just mouth watering. The care they put into the ingredients and the customer service is apparent every time you come here!

Funny story, the first time I brought my best friend and her husband to Pequods, he was like why's the crust burnt?! I said no, not burnt it's caramelized. Now when he was in Afghanistan he would tell her how much he missed his "burnt crust from Pequods!"

I may not go into the restaurant very often, but I'm sure glad they deliver. You can't go wrong with what I refer to as "The Chicagoan Deep Dish" - because we all know that Giordano's (while tasty as well in its own right) is the tourist attraction.

As a native South Sider we all have our pizza shop loyalties, but every so often you have to stray and find out if all he talk is just that or if you've found another place to add to the rotation.

I'll start by telling you this place gets packed and there's almost no way around it, be prepared to get drinks at the bar and average an hour plus wait during peak times, also if you're not aware pan pizza will take anywhere from 45-130 depending on how busy it is, factor that into your plans.

Now for the pizza, it was amazing, ordered sausage, pep, and peppers with extra sauce.

Caramelized crust was spot on, cooked perfectly and dos not disappoint in any factor, crust, cheese or toppings.

With a great tap list of craft and many TVs for the games it will be added to my list of highly rated Chicago pizza joints.
wayyyy to much bread it was like eating a bread sandwich with a little bit of cheese

My rating is based on the delivery ordering experience.  I called in to place an order and was greeted by a very rude and impatient employee on the other end of the line.  Someone having direct communication with customers should have better customer service than what I received.  The experience was so awful that it left a distasteful flavor in my mouth before even trying Pequod's for the first time, which I was super excited for.  To make matters even worse, they got the address wrong so the poor delivery driver had to turn around to get back to my  apartment.  

The pizza crust bottom was soggy by the time we got to enjoy the pizza, over an hour later.  The za was decent but nothing extraordinary.  I'll try Pequods another time as a dine in customer and hopefully have a better experience, but in the mean time I'll keep exploring other pizza options.

Pequod's pizza is cheesy goodness. Thin crust or pan pizza, you really can't go wrong at Pequod's.

Bonus: get the mozzarella sticks. For some reason, I think they're better here than anywhere else in the city.

I hate to leave a glowing review, because I'd like tourists to continue thinking Giordano's and Lou Malnati's are the deep dish gold standard. However, it's the best deep dish in the city, making it the best deep dish the United States. The wait can be long, yes, but with plenty of seating and a beer or two to pass the time, it's worth the wait.

Very good Chicago dish deep! The only issue I have is the pizza isn't the same if you order for pick up or take your leftovers home and eat it the next day.... It must be eaten straight out of the oven in the pan. If you do happen to have leftovers reheat in a cast iron pan, you'll enjoy it much more then in the microwave or oven.

Best Chicago style pizza in the city; the place you actually order from regularly as a Chicagoan.

Pan - sausage and pepperoni

Ate there in person recently; ate upstairs and it was a fun change!

Best deep dish in Chicago! The crust in thinner. You tell yourself one slice but always eat 2 because it just melts in your mouth and isn't too heavy for a deep dish. Great for eating in or take out. Free parking on the side streets too!
Unquestionably the best pizza in Chicago.  Yeah, you may have to wait a bit, but it's soooooo worth it. So sad that I moved away to the southern burbs and can't get it as often.  They are magical!!!

I wanted to love this place! We ordered a pizza to go and had a beer at the bar while we waited. Service was friendly and accommodating. But the pizza desperately needed salt. The sauce is my favorite part of a pizza, and this one had no flavor. I loved the famed crust of course, but a good crust does not an entire pizza-eating experience make, so I won't be back.

Delicious everything and a kind staff that didn't mind this professor sitting and grading papers on a packed Saturday. Great service when your stomach us gnawing at your backbone. The staff did alot of kiddy flirting back and forth management may wish to address this so the staff is paying attention solely to clients as opposed to each other

I love this place. This is my go to when out-of-town visitors want to truly experience Chicago deep dish pizza.

The pizza here is way better than Lou Malnati's and Giodano's. Worth coming out here and waiting in line in order to get your fix of delicious pizza. I usually go with basil, mushroom, and sausage, and I would highly recommend that combination. You will need a medium to feed about 3 people (each get 2 slices) - and trust me, you will be plenty full. Note this is deep dish, I have not given their thin crust a try.

I've converted so many people to Pequod's. It the true local Chicago deep dish pizza experience. My only complaint and the only thing that's holding Pequod's from getting a five star rating is the fact that the quality sadly is not consistent. There will be times when Pequod's completely knock the ball out of the park and give you an amazing pizza, but there are also other times when the crust is burnt or not fully cooked.

They don't take real reservations - you can call ahead but what happens is that you get to jump to the top of list, which will still require some wait (unlike most other restaurants, where you will have a table ready as soon as you walk in). I have ordered for pick-up in the past (it took about 50 minutes), but the pizza experience is not the same. That same day, delivery was about 2 hours. So I would plan ahead if you would like to order a pizza and eat from your home.

I would say to truly experience Pequods, you have to eat the pizza there. When it pops right out of the oven, it is amazing. The long wait is crazy. I have waited 2+ hours in the past. There is a Barnes and Nobles nearby and that's where I go to hang out while waiting. It's worth it and just do it!

This was the worst pizza ever. Ever, in history of pizzas or pizzerias.
My family and I tried to get in once since they were highly recommended after a movie at Regal, they were too busy and not friendly at all.
This week, we went and finally made it! No line around 5ish pm. We had a small pan for 2 and after eating 2 small pieces, I could not move and breath the entire evening. I felt so heavy and bloated! I read the reviews and one woman was saying they don't let the crust mature and that makes you bloated, which makes sense. Basically the pizza was not done at well. It was like eating semi done crust where the cheese did not even melt. The toppings were not evenly distributed.
The waitress was so indifferent, as most of the stuff, some college not caring kids.
Bathroom was clean and that's the best of all, OMG.
I want my money back, yes, I do. So worthless!!!!

P.S. The wine list does not exist. They serve wine, but you don't know what the choices are and how much does it cost. Ridiculous!

Pequod's is, by far, my favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago. Now...I know that this is a rather sensitive topic...given there are some hard-core Giordano's and Lou's supporters out here. But let me just say, I'm reviewing from the point of view of an "outsider" (Cali-girl) and that I actually prefer thin crust over deep dish. But I've come to really be able to appreciate a good deep dish pizza, and Pequod's is where it's at! I particularly love the carmelized crispy crust. My fav.

If you're not sure, just try it for yourself and do the taste test. Either way, I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy it, if not completely agree with me that it's the best out of the main deep dish places here in Chi-town.
The best deep dish pizza in Chicago if you get it hot from the oven. Carryout is not as good because the steam from the box causes the crust to get soggy.

The pizza was good. Service was as well, the waitress was nice. I got the personal pan with pepperoni and it was the perfect amount! I asked for fresh basil after I placed the initial order. The server told me it would make it on the pizza, but it didn't. Other than that, everything went great! I arrived on a Monday at 10:00 pm, so there was no wait for a table.

I don't know if I'd ever wait over 30 minutes for a seat like some of the other yelpers have indicated. The dining room/ambiance is nothing special, so I'd just get it to go at that point.

We got the deep dish pepperoni and sausage pizza and it was perfect! We had family in town and wanted to show them the best Chicago pizza and it definitely did not disappoint! Can't wait to come back again!

Amazing deep dish pizza! One can't go to Chicago and not try a deep dish pizza. The toppings are a bit pricey but well worth. The crust was crispy and not at all soggy. I recommend Pequod's to anyone interested in trying Chicago style deep dish pizza.

Called in for a deep dish pizza to go, told it would be an hour, which was expected. Got there and ended up waiting an additional hour for the pizza along with others who had called in. It was a Sunday night, so I could understand it being a little busy, but the fact that I had called in a to go order and had to wait 2 hours for a pizza was absolutely ridiculous. The pizza wasn't even that great when I finally got around to eating it.
Very good food, but a little slow. Crowded establishment and very busy on the weekends.
Very delicious pizza with generous amount of cheese and perfectly seasoned. They crust is so crunchy and tasty. Absolutely one the bests in town. Only downside long time of service.

BEST DEEP DISH PIZZA IN CHICAGO!

Ok, that's all the yelling I'll do, but yes, just so you get this straight, you can't beat Pequods, it is the absolute best!

If you want to have the warranty of getting seated, you have 2 options:
1- get there before 6 on a week day
2-  call ahead and he put in their list 24 hours before you want to dine  [they don't have reservations, but if you do this they cut your waiting time by half once you get there]

If you like pepperoni pizza, go for it, they sprinkle that one with magical rainbow powder that really pairs very well with the cheese caramelization that happens on the cheese at the edge of all the crust.

Service has always been great every time we went, and they have a good arrange of local brews.

Please tourist, skip Giordanos, come here to get the real deal!

The pizza is totally worth the wait (even if you call in a "reservation" you are only given priority so may wait, especially if a bigger party).  That crust...people were not lying.  

And actually their Pequod salad is pretty good and so is their vegable soup!
I think I just had a religious experience at this place and now worship all things with Giardiniera. A literal flavortown in my mouth rn.

So many pizza choices in Chicago, and I'm sure there are a dozen good ones.  Pequods is unique for two reasons.  First off this location is more of a local hangout than a tourist spot, and there are $5.75 lunch deals to be had via Yelp for a pizza and a drink.  Secondly, their deep dish pizza is baked with some cheese on outside edge of crust so that it caramelizes into a semi-burnt dreamy nirvana of crisp cheese heaven.  A personal size is almost too much, especially when you add on a $2.50 salad.  Overall the best value for our dollar on our trip, and a casual, local hangout type atmosphere.  Would definitely recommend anybody visiting Chicago make the short Uber/Lyft trip up to north side to eat here.

We got there right before dinner rush so we sat right down, pretty decent wait it appeared to be if you're not early!!! Food was great, we had a deep dish and thin crust pizza with salads.  Pizzas take about 40 minutes so don't come on starving, order a salad and wait!! It will be worth it! Servers are slammed but take good care of you.
Best pizza in Chicago .. Hello run here dont walk this is a must for every foodie ..

I think Pequod's is overhyped. I was expecting a really delicious pizza, but it was just ok. Not terrible but I didn't really enjoy it either.

It was like eating pizza bread topped with tomato sauce and bread. The 'crust' was about 3/4 inch of thick puffy, spongy bread. The tomato sauce was overly flavored like spaghetti sauce, it was almost cloying and didn't taste natural to me. The cheese didn't have much flavor and I didn't really like the taste of the sausage either.

Pequod's has a loud, lively bar-like atmosphere, it looks like a bar too.

I think I'll stick to Lou Malnati's. (For me, Lou Malnati's far outways Pequod's)
Favorite pizza! Even chose this as my meal after finishing the marathon. Go for the deep dish with sausage.
I bring my family and friends visiting Chicago to this famous hot spot for some genuine deep dish. Sitting at the bar is my favorite spot, but be aware of the amount of take out people order.

I had my FIRST Chicago deep dish pizza here after my Chicago-resident friend had recommended it. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our large party. We ordered several pies and tried them with different types of toppings. Everything was delicious and I finally gained some insight into people's love for deep dish pizza.

Not sure what the whole fuss is about this place... The deep dish is just okay. Their thin slice pizza is really bad, so bad that I'd rather buy a whole Little Caesar's for that $5.

Last time I came here, I waited 45 min for just a slice of cheese pizza. When it came it looked like it had been cooked a while ago just warmed up. Yes, I got there late in the evening, but still - consistency is key!

The salad my sister ordered had an expired, smelly salad dressing. Overall experience did not match the rating here.

Don't think I'll be going there again! Just next door for some drinks at The Drinkingbird. :)

I'm surprised I haven't written a review for this place! One of the first places I checked out in Chicago for deep dish and I've now tried Gino's East and Lou Malnati's. I prefer this one because of the crust and the delicious toppings and sauce. I really enjoyed the caramelized crust with its yummy crunchiness. The sauce is also delicious and there is a good balance between dough and toppings/sauce. Some places have tooo much dough or too much sauce. I liked it here because it didn't feel like either was overwhelming. Pizza takes about 45 minutes to bake so be ready for that. We ordered appetizers which were just alright (chicken strips) but were delivered so speedily. Come here for the pizza!

Great experience, great pizza, great value! I had heard this was the place to go and it was. Nice, cozy, local neighborhood joint with friendly staff, totally took care of me and made me me feel welcome. The name is pronounced Pea-Quad and that's the name of the Chef from the book Moby Dick. They also have a bar next door called Whales Tales where patrons can go and enjoy a few drinks while waiting to get in, think you might even get a discount if they know you're waiting to get in for pizza. The lunch special was 4.95 for a seven inch pan pizza and a drink, for this quality that's insane! Really, perhaps the best pan pizza I've ever had and it was a thing of beauty to eat and look at. Such perfect sauce, caramelized cheese and pepperoni. I also had a very good appetizer of garlic sticks and marinara. My total bill was maybe 10.65 or so. I was worried about long lines, so I got there rift when they opened at 11am on a Wednesday morning and there were only two ahead of me. If anyone ever asks me where I think the best pizza in Chicago is, this is the place I'll send them!

pics.caption: This is insane value. Lunch special was 4.95, cost a bit more since I had pepperoni added. Had a garlic bread app too.
What a divine piece of pie!

review.des: I have been going to Pequod's for years and when it is on its a 5+ but lately its inconsistent at best.  I love this place and want to change this to a 5.

On my 3 day trip to Chicago, I made it a point to try 4 of the restaurants that continuously showed up on several "Chicago's best deep dish pizza" lists. For such a popular restaurant I was surprised to learn that they deliver. This was great as I did not have to trek out using mass transit and walk 0.8 mi from the closest station like I was planning to do in order to try this highly rated pizza.
I am not sure if "stuffed" is synonymous with "deep-dish" because this pizza was definitely deep-dish but most of the depth was the bready dough vs other deep-dish pizzas that consisted of a thick layer of cheese and whatever other toppings. It is easy to get awed by the nice crispy crust of the pizza. I originally gave this 4 stars but when I came back and tasted the left overs of all my deep-dish pizzas side by side, I realized that comparatively I enjoyed it less than the others because it was mostly bread/dough. I am glad I did not have to make the trek for this one as I could have done without it.

Woman answered the phone. Apparently I was asking her too many questions. She huffed and hung up on me. Called back and told her I wasn't done ordering and she said that I was "taking too long. There's a website for questions." And she hung up AGAIN. Heard the pizza is great (didn't get a chance to order because I was hung up on twice?), but I customer service is more important to me.

I was only in Chicago for a day and wanted the best pizza in the whole city and I got what I wanted.

They caramelize their crust and I read that they're the only people to do so. The pizza looks like it would be super heavy but surprisingly it was not. The sauce has really good flavor and the personal was definitely a good size to share if you want to continue eating at multiple places for the rest of the day. The cost of the pizza was really cheap too. The sausage was bigger than what I'm used to, they appear to be more like meatballs instead.

Atmosphere was solid, they played good music but that's just my opinion.

Overrated.
The caramelized crust that everyone raves about was nothing more than an entirely charred ring of mozzarella cheese along the sides of the pizza. Fillings were nothing fancy either, very standard flavors that one can easily replicate at home.

pics.caption: Single pan pizza with spinach and ground beef
Single pan pizza with spinach and ground beef

review.des: Horrible. All hype, no substance. Terrible customer service, sub-par product, and just an all around bad experience. Most overrated place in Chicago.

This is somewhat unique pizza. Many like it, some don't. Once you know what it is, when you're in the mood for it, it never disappoints. The carmelized cheese edges are great but for me the sauce is a bit too stringent for general consumption. Also, the pan pizza is very thick and bready which makes it no light meal. Other well known pan pizza's are quite different.

The thin crust disappointed me . Fairly thick crust for a thin pizza and also, quite bready and not much personality in the crust. Interestingly, the left overs were much better than fresh, IF you heat it up properly. NEVER MICROWAVE PIZZA! It turns into a soggy mess. Try putting it on a frying pan on no more than medium heat. Heat it slowly. The crust will crisp up beautifully, it will heat evenly all the way up through the toppings, and the cheese will remelt and caramelize around the edges on the pan.

Get involved, that's about all that I need to say about this place!  I had heard for weeks how great their pizza was.  I was told it was a deep dish sort of a dough, bread, sauce, garlic, seasoning, creation.  Umm, count me in!

I went on a Friday night, carry out.  I came home, devoured basically the whole large pizza, felt imeediately ill because I ate too much, and wanted to eat more 7-minutes later.  I loved it!

I think in person would be better, but overall I need more of Pequods in my life.

Honestly, the only reason I gave it 1 star, is because there is no 0 star rating.

My friends and I showed up to try what was recommended to us as Chicago's best deep dish pizza. We waited over an hour to be seated, which was expected, and when we sat down to order we were told it would take another hour for the pizza to come out.

Shortly after another hour our server came back out (for the first time since she handed us our water and took our order) to tell us that the kitchen had accidentally put a couple of extra toppings on the pizza. At this point, we were fine with that, we just wanted to eat.

So when the pizza came out we realized it wasn't our pizza at all; there were no mushrooms, or jalapeños like we ordered. Just a random pizza with random toppings. The crust was burnt black, and was difficult to cut through.

In Nashville we have a good Chicago style deep dish restaurant that I wanted to compare to an authentic pizza place in Chicago, and hands down the Nashville restaurant won the comparison. In fact, you can't even compare the two. That would be like comparing a 5 star steak house to McDonald's. Pequods was an outright disappointment, and I regret the 2 and a half hours of my life/vacation I wasted there.

It was my first visit to Chicago and my first time trying deep dish pizza. My bf had tried the big name deep dish pizza places so I suggested we try Pequods, a place he hadn't been before.

Waiting for the pizza felt like forever because we were both so hungry we didn't have the energy to talk about anything except when the food would be out. Luckily we had came before the rush so it only took about 15-20 minutes which is standard btw.

The pizza was amazing. They cook the crust with cheese so it's like a crispy cheese crust. Just imagine when you melt cheese in a frying pan and it turns that golden brown. Imagine a piece of that on the crust. Every bite is just the right amount of oozing cheese, pepperoni, sauce and crust.

To make it better, the pizza wasn't as oily as some pizzas can be so you don't even feel guilty as you eat your second slice of deep dish and eye your third slice. :) My bf and I shared a small which was more than enough.

I've had super mixed experiences with Pequod's.  The first time I tried it, it was the best deep dish I've ever had.  Perfectly cooked crust, awesome sausage, tons of cheese.  However, the last two times I ordered from them, it took almost two hours for my order to arrive, and it wasn't quite as good.  It got a bit doughy, and the crust wasn't as good as that first night.  I'll probably give it one last try for delivery, and I'm guessing it's best eaten at the restaurant, but I've had less than stellar experiences overall.

By far the best pizza in the city. They have accommodated big groups for me when needed. It can be a wait and even for pick up so be strategic when going or just know you are going to wait. They have an amazing lunch deal that I highly recommend. Whenever I have people come to Chicago that have never been we ALWAYS go here.

It was good, very good. But my personal preference is still Malnati's.

The big difference is the the crust. The crust here was thick and airy, like focaccia bread. If that's what you like, this is your place.
Good service, great pizza. Friendly staff, would definitely come back again. Parking can be a little complicated.

It's pretty sad because I had such high hopes being that it was voted best in the nation but it let me down.
Upon arrival we sat very quickly which was another sign of awesome but it went downhill from there. To start our waitress smelled due to lack of deodorant and her stench was directed to my face with her wide open arms. I overlooked it and we ordered.

We ordered the stuffed crust which describes itself as cheese oozing from the crust but when we received it there was barely any cheese at all.

It arrived to our table swiftly but upon our first bite, my husband and I both found a way to admit it was subpar.

We decided we were full and when the waitresses walked by I said "can we get a box and the check." Without saying a word she used the pizza pliers to pick it up and allowed it to sit at her knee as she walked away from the kitchen with the pizza being moved around her personal space before she finally walked to the kitchen. She came back to our table without a word check on top of pizza looked away and walked off.

We both looked at each other trying to figure out if we were rude to her at some point but could not think of anything as she barely came to our table in the first place.

Bottom line. I will never go again and both my husband and i plan to apologize to our usual pizza place for wasting our money on such a subpar, rude and smelly experience.

Side note: my husband used the washroom while there and he described it as gross and dirty.
Love this place. Very Chicago. It is difficult to park yet it is worth it. Great pizza, great staff.

Pizza is great but changed their delivery zone. They didn't update the website so very confused on where they deliver to now. Either way, their delivery zone is too small and they should consider rezoning. I'm sure their customers would pay a small delivery fee.
Would have gotten a 5 star if the cheese bread was better.  Great service. AMAZING CHEESY CRUST! Get extra sauce.  It has really fresh tasting tomatoes.

I absolutely love pizza and after first reading about Pequod's in Bon Appetit (my food bible), I had been jonesing to swing by for a personal pan pizza. I finally did just that and I got the lunch special for $4.95 which included a personal pan pizza and a soda. Since this was my first visit, I wanted to try the pizza with cheese only. I was quoted a 30 minute wait and it did take 30 minutes. I love burned cheese and the pizza was good, especially the crust! While it was good, in my opinion, it doesn't top Giordano's, which still ranks as my favorite deep dish pizza ever.

Best deep dish pizza CRUST, by far. I'm a huge fan of the extra crispy crust with some burnt bits of cheese - I practically finish it before I've even worked on the pizza itself. So freaking delicious.

Long, long lines, but definitely worth it. I've waited 2 hours on a Sunday night, and even in my hangry state, could not be unhappy with Pequods. You can call in to theoretically "shorten" your wait time, but when I called and later arrived, they just put my name down underneath everyone else... after confirming with me "Ah you called, we'll let you know." I'm doubtful of this system.

NOTABLE:
-Their lunch special is pretty ridiculous - I think it's like $5! - so hop on that if you can.
-This one may be obvious but do not order the Pequod's Salad. One, who goes to a deep dish pizza place to order a salad? Two... It's lettuce with pizza toppings.

Well worth the hour wait to get seated and 40 minutes for the deep dish pie to be baked. Loved loved loved. Told GM when he stopped by the table that he must open in Milwaukee. I'll be there daily. Mmmm.

Pequod's is in just the right location. It's near the Regal Cinema and other great businesses in the Chicago area. The pans they cook the pizza in caramelize the cheese and you'll find yourself abandoning your table manners and picking and pulling the ingredients off and nibbling ferociously. The items are cooked to order so it'll be at least 30 minutes for some hot and delicious memories. The staff are very nice and will try to seat you upstairs or downstairs based on your preference. Be forewarned, during peak times there can be a wait since many patrons will wait for a movie to start or watch sports as they dine. Parking is located in a nearby garage as street parking is a rarity.

Customer service is shit. Don't get me wrong, I understand that when a restaurant has a substantial following, they give less shits about their customers, but this is ridiculous.  We ordered a pizza at 126 am, had to repeat my credit card number 6 times before she actually got it right. Then, we call to check on our order and the person can find no order for us. None. Gave our number, name we put it under, address, nothing can be found. Super pissed. Finally we get a manager on the phone. She says they guarantee it by 302am?  Ok. It's 303am, and guess what? No pizza.  We called back to see where it is and with a bitchy attitude says its in the same place that it has been the last two times you called.

Fuck this place.

If this review were for the pizza itself, it would be five stars. But when I called for delivery, and pulled up the delivery zone map, they refused to deliver to us. We live in Logan Square at Milwaukee and Sacramento. As you can see in the map, that is clearly within the boundaries of their delivery zone. And yet they refused to deliver. So I asked to speak to the manager, who unapologetically also refused to take the order, claiming my address "didn't show up in their system." You can't show one thing on your website and then just respond with "Well I don't know what to tell ya." Beware Logan Square residents. No Pequods for you.
This is a popular pizza joint...I get it.  But the fact that their employees were taking up seats on a busy Saturday night is a big no no.

First off, any place that features a sperm whale with panties on his head maniacally riding a bike of some sort hawg is my kind of place.

So after a $25 can ride,  I walk in the door and it's a neighborhood pizza place. Local all the way. Waitresses and hostess are polite, but not kissing your butt like you're some tourist.

Beers are straight-forward. A few local selections, and the usual mass market stuff.

So on to the pies: order thin or pan crust, toppings are extra, and there are lots of them.

We got two pan pies:
1. Pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, fresh garlic awesomeness.

2. Olives, and a bunch of other veggies for the vegetaters.

After a few beers, while waiting for the pies:

I watched chick ice skating on the Olympics. Gotta love that chick ice skating...

The pizza: THICK crust. Burnt black at the top edges from the cast iron pan. HUGE toppings, like sausage the size of a half-dollar. Pepperoni? Yup it's on there, a lot of it. Every now and then, a sharp bit of garlic, and plenty of mushrooms goodness. Crisp bottom to the crust, but light interior. Quite a bit of dough.

A lot of places do that thing where the toppings are in the middle and topped with sauce. Not here, it's definitely a pan pizza with the goodness on top.

In short: This is one badass pie.

I need a nap. A long one.

I give it a solid 4.5 stars, and we'll see if they get that last half when I come back for the thinner crust pies.
Hands down one of my favorite pizza spots in Chicago!! The caramelized crust is life!!! Staff is friendly as well although it can get packed on busier days!

Amazing! Worth the wait for sure, not to mention you can go to the bar next door and have a drink while you are waiting.  

This is the best Chicago has to offer no doubt. The Pep/sausage was to die for!  I can't wait to visit again.

Come during the weekday for their lunch special!!! Such a deal!!! 7" Pan Cheese Pizza and a fountain soda for $4.95 and each toppings for 80 cents more! It was so good!!! I'm not a big fan of pizza in general and I had deep dish before in California... but this was surprisingly good and you can't beat their lunch deal! Thanks for the great experience! They do not take reservations, but you can call ahead of time for them to put your name down and when you arrive, you will be moved up to the top of the waiting list! Seating is not guaranteed however!

pics.caption: Pan Deep Dish Pizza with Sausage and mushroom!

review.des:
It was time to try a new pizza place.  Previously a Lou Malnati's and Jet's Pizza only fan, but the last two carry-out experiences at both left me ready to explore other options.

Pequod's product performed perfectly.  Totally worth the 1+ hour carry out time.  Totally worth waiting in the pickup line in the restaurant which was packed like the Red Line at rush hour.

The pan pizza (their deep dish) was cooked perfectly, with the cheese just crisped just the way I like it around the edges.  The dough was appropriately cooked-through and crispy on the bottom, and offset by the heavenly layer of softness where it met the balanced sauce and toppings.  Ohh, the sauce.  Not too pasty, not too watery, with just the level saltiness and seasoning.  As with most pizza experiences, the sauce made the pizza.  Got my money's worth of toppings.  Cheese layer was thankfully just the right thickness.  The only thing I'd change would be to add the fresh basil later in the cooking process so that it didn't get so crispy too.

Totally their own pizza recipe, but I might compare a little to the bumpiness, crispiness, and interest of NYC's Prince Street Pizza, and the dough recipe of Detroit's Pizza Papalis.

Absolutely will be returning.

Pizza is fantastic and always rated very highly in any post you'll see about the best Chicago pizza. ALWAYS call ahead/make a reservation - This will move you up on the list when you arrive, but you will still probably have about an hour wait.

IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. You'll even have to wait for the pizza (deep dish), but trust me, it's worth it.

Started with cheesy garlic which was really good - and mozzarella - just ok. Our pizza is pepperoni and sausage.  In my opinion it is good and different for those not familiar with deep dish pizza. Otherwise it is just ok. Good place to visit for out of town-ers.

I had heard so many great things about this place and was super excited to try it. I had the deep dish pizza with mushroom and spinach and it was so delicious! We got the fries for an appetizer (the pizza takes about 45 minutes to make) and they were perfectly cooked and crunchy! The staff was super nice and friendly. Can't wait to go back!

I've heard a lot of great things about this place - specifically the caramelized crust.  So naturally, I had to check out one of the great Chicago pizza joints while in Chicago.  

The wait wasn't too bad - approximately 30 minutes on a Sunday night.  We were seated upstairs.  My only regret is that we weren't able or asked to order ahead of time.  These deep dish pizzas take a long time to cook/bake.  When the pizza arrived..... disappointment.  The caramelized crust just reminded me of BURNT crust.  The pizza was so doughy.  Toppings were sparse.  A centimeter of toppings and cheese, on top of an inch of dough.  Atkins lovers would cry.

Now, it's not terrible pizza.  I still ate it.  But given all the other Chicago style pizza joints in Chicago, I wouldn't come here if I was here on vacation for just a few days.

Ok...if I could eat here everyday I would.  Amazzzzing pizza. Best crust ever.  And if you don't believe my review just ask the thousand people that are there, every-time & anytime you try to go (that would be my only complaint). Seriously even at lunch, during the week this place is packed & it's huge.  But major bonus points to them for buying the bar next doors, so you can have a drink while you wait for a table.  I like their style of thinking.
